scenes.location: DRESSING ROOM- FIGHT CLUB/ BAR- TIJUANA MEXICO 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open on a mural of Jesus Christ, painted on the wall o the bar. We pan down to reveal dank surroundings where disinterested patrons are watching a brutal flyweight mat between TWO HISPANIC FIGHTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of a water stained box where ADONIS JOHNSON (20'S, Black) leans from one side to another, attempting to stay loose. FLORES (30's) a battle scarred Mexican fighter, st across from Adonis, thick and menacing, with a neutral expression. Adonis glances at his opponent, who stares ba emptily. The door opens off screen.

dialogues.speaker: REFFEREE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Vamanos! The two fighters stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, prances around the ring, avoiding Florez who is struggling to make contact, and growing tired. Florez cor Adonis up against the ropes, and after missing a few jabs WHAM he ducks into Adonis and lands a pretty deliberate h but above his left eye, opening a deep gash. As Adonis tr to recover: WHAM WHAM, he lands two bone crunching hooks the gut. Adonis takes an airless breath and stumbles back to the middle of the ring, wiping blood from the gash as the bel sounds. Adonis heads to the corner, where a WAITRESS (40s) puts a stool down. He sits and she squirts water into his mouth. The bell for Round 3 sounds. He starts towards Flores, wi more bounce in his stance. Flores takes a swing at his he and Adonis evades. Flores swings again, and again, even harder, and Adonis ducks both and then crushes a left uppercut into Flores' chin, followed by a flurry of alternating punches that send Flores crashing to the matt unconscious. The ref flies in waving, and Adonis spits his mouthpiece and heads to the corner.

dialogues.speaker: REF
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) 6-7-8-9-10 Adonis looks on and starts biting at his glove to take i off. The ref walks over and pulls $500 out of his pocket, hands it to Adonis right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several cars line up at the inspection booths. Adonis, dr in a primer colored 1967 Mustang, holding a T- shirt to h eye. He hands his passport to the BORDER PATROL AGENT, wh looks at him, shakes his head, and signals him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis sits in a crowded ER waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Donnie Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis’ Mustang pulls into a hillside driveway. He punche code into a keypad, and a large iron gate opens. As he dr up the cobblestone driveway we pull back to reveal a breathtaking mansion, we notice the fresh bandage over hi eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand wearing a massive wedding ring scoops beef stew in bowl. We pull up to reveal MARY-ANNE CREED (70s), dressed modestly, but a regalness about her. She slides the bowl in front of Adonis, who sits at the kitchen island, and pours herself a glass of vodka. She p her hand to his cut.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Do you have to come here after your fights? It’s like you want to rub my nose in it.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: It’s tradition. (beat) Don’t you want to know if I won?

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. Even when you win, you’re losing. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You given any more thought to going back to school? Adonis doesn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about the internship?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Maybe... if it works with whatever schedule Duke puts me on.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Have you even talked to him?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow... what you got on TV?

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Watching our boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN- Walter White, in a desert standoff with member a rival cartel, when... it cuts to credits. Mary Anne and Adonis sit next to each other on the couch. Adonis’ shoes off, his white socks dangling like a toddle

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You got another one in you?

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Naw, grandma’s gotta head off to bed... you gonna stay the night?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Naw, I’m gonna get to the house... Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: How's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: She cool, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Good... that’s good. Adonis stands up, and gives her a big hug.  10 11 MARY ANNE (CONT’D) See you tomorrow? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis’ Mustang parks next to a Subaru SUV in front of th two car garage of a small house in Silverlake. INT. CLABSADDLE HOUSE- ADONIS’ BEDROOM- NIGHT- ONE HOUR L Adonis sits in his room (a converted two car garage). He his winnings into a large duffle bag, slides it under his futon, plops down on it, and turns on HBO ON DEMAND. He h play on a Boxing Documentary. ON THE SCREEN WE SEE- INT. PORTER’S CAR- DAY- TOXTETH, LIVERPOOL, UNITED KINGDO The camera shoots “PRETTY” RICKY PORTER (White, mid 30's, Scouse accent)- the unanimous #1 pound for pound fighter the world- as he walks around his old neighborhood with h sons JUNIOR (8), and G (6, and small for his age) surroun by a nefarious entourage.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: See I’m from Toxteth. Nothin wrong with it, it made me. At the mention of Toxteth, some members of his entourage firing pistols at the camera. Porter, and his crew walk u a boxing gym, nestled in the corner of a decaying neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (motions to Junior) I was a lot smaller than him, a cheeky little bastard I was. I used to get me ass kicked coming home from school every day. A wiry, bespectacled man sticks his head out of the doorw and looks into the camera with disdain- this is GILES HOL (55, White) despite his slight build, he demands respect.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: You gonna train or be a movie star? Porter turns to Holiday and smiles.  12

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Come down here, mate. Holiday reluctantly obliges. He pats G on the head.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He found me, after some Evertonians bashed me head in. (motions to Holiday) So he brought me in ere. Taught me how to fight... Stopped pickin’ on me after that didn’t they? INSIDE THE GYM we cut to Porter- working drills with Holi

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Porter is expected to be sentenced within the year on a handgun charge that could land him behind bars for up to 7 years. We see Porter being interviewed in a close- up.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: I feel like I could fight another 20 years. But numbers catch up to everybody, so I’m treating this like its me last... Junior- wearing his Dad’s gold chain around his neck (it’ huge on him) standing outside of the ring, mimicking his dad's moves. G watches him closely.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: His opponent, Danny Wheeler, is arguably his most formidable challenge, yet. IN A HIGHLIGHT REEL we see shots of DANNY “STUNTMAN” WHEE (Late 20s, Black) taking out several opponents in the rin There is a cut to TONY “DUKE” BURTON standing next to him he holds up a belt post- fight. Adonis looks on at the screen, anger flashing over his fa He turns it off, picks up his dumbbells, and starts lifti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis sleeps under a blanket. The bedroom door creaks op and small set of eyes peek through. KAYLA CLABSADDLE (8, Biracial, curly hair, DEAF) walks into the room. She walk over to Adonis and gently pushes his shoulders. He opens eyes. (They talk in American Sign Language w/ subtitles.)  13

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Wake up. Breakfast is ready. He rolls back over and puts the pillow over his face. Kay jumps on top of him, landing right on his sore ribs.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Ahh, shit! He pushes her, sending her to the carpet, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re too heavy for that. As she stands Adonis sits up, and she catches sight of hi bandage.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You were fighting again!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Don’t tell mom.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What’s in it for me? Adonis stares her down for a beat, then motions to his wa on the coffee table. Kayla grabs it, and brings it back t him. He pulls out a $5 bill and gives it to her. She puts in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom made you breakfast, what are you gonna do? Adonis looks at his phone, and sees that he overslept.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m running late. Go make me a shake, and bring it to me. Kayla nods and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight streams into a modest kitchen. LISA CLABSADDLE (Black, a young looking 40) scrambles eggs next to DARYL CLABSADDLE (White, 40's) who pours coffee. Lisa watches intently as Kayla scoops powder from Adonis’ muscle milk pours it into shake thermos and then adds water. She closes it up and starts shaking it. Lisa looks at Dar who is watching as well, and walks away shaking his head.  14 Lisa taps Kayla. Who turns to her, innocently, shaking aw at the shake.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Is your brother awake? Kayla guiltily looks back, still shaking the milkshake. S shrugs “I don’t know”.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is he still in his room? Kayla shrugs again. Lisa gives her the mother’s stare of death. INT. ADONIS’ BEDROOM 14 Adonis, pulls a hoodie over his head and preps his bag.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How could anybody drink this first thing in the morning? It’s disgusting. Adonis turns around to see Lisa standing in the doorway, holding his thermos. Kayla standing next to her guiltily. Lisa walks down the steps into the room and hands Adonis thermos. He takes it, trying to hide his face, but he’s t late.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, what happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Stiches.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I’m talking about before the stitches smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I got into a fight at a bar.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You're 23 years old. At some point you gotta stop solving problems with your fists. You need to get a job. Working out at the gym everyday doesn’t count. Having heard enough, he heads for the door.  15 16

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Adonis stops. Turns around.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, just come and eat some real food. I cooked your favorite. Sit down, and have some family time.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Family time?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (beat) You know I saw your mom last night.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How’d that go?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You mean, “How is she?” (beat) She’s alone... This lands on Lisa, hard. Adonis walks over to her, gives a kiss on the cheek, and heads out. EXT. DUKE’S BOXING GYM PARKING LOT- SOUTH LOS ANGELES- DA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Adonis’ car turns into a gravel parking lot, in a dilapid neighborhood. He parks, hops out with his duffle bag. We track up to reveal the sign. “DUKE’S BOXING GYM: WORLD CLASS.” INT. DUKE’S BOXING GYM- DAY- CONTINUOUS 16 Adonis changes into his boxing shoes and heads towards a large ring where SEVERAL BOXERS are paired up, working drills. Sitting outside the ring is DUKE (70s, black). Ad walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m ready to train. Let me know what warm-ups you want me starting with.  17

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Adonis tosses the open duffle bag on the edge of the ring right in front of Duke.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: That's my training fees for a year up front. Duke peers into the bag for a beat, sighs, then hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Go home, son. Duke goes to turn back, and Adonis grabs his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving this gym today until you agree to train me. Duke looks into Adonis’ eyes closely. And turns back to t ring, verbally coaching up the athletes inside. Adonis pu past Duke and jumps into the ring. INT. RING- DUKE’S BOXING GYM- CONTINUOUS 17 The boxers stop sparring, and they look at Adonis, who tu to the corner and shakes the contents of his gym bag out- gloves, a mouthpiece, and $10,000 cash.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I got 10 stacks right here. Cash! Ready for whoever wants to come get it. Adonis puts on his gloves and turns around to the fighter the ring. They look at him, but none are up for the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Adonis!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Easy money, right? Outside the ring, fighters have stopped their workouts an inch closer to the brewing spectacle. A fighter, tall and lean, about Adonis’ age starts to approach the ring, this KEV. Adonis locks eyes with him.  10.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kev, you gonna be first up?

dialogues.speaker: KEV
dialogues.text: Look at your eye, cuz. Looks like somebody beat me to it. The room guffaws... Adonis doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: So it should be easy for you right?? I'’11 put my money where my mouth is. Adonis bends down and clumsily grabs a rubber banded stac money. He places it in his mouth, biting down on it like mouthpiece. Kev shakes his head at this, bites down on his mouthpiece and slides into the ring. The two fighters circle each ot Kev’s stance high and tight- Adonis’ low, flamboyant, and taunting. Kev swings a right jab, but Adonis easily evades it. Kev swings again, Adonis leans back drops his guard, and star to rock side to side. Frustrated, Kev takes two more swin and Adonis parries one, ducks the other and comes hard wi right cross to Kev’s chin. Kev’s jaw rattles and he hits floor in a heap, face down, unconscious. Adonis spits the money out and it lands on Kev’s back.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon! Who next, huh? Which one of ya'll want it with the rich kid. You pick em Duke! You pick which one!

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I’m next. Adonis turns to see DANNY WHEELER (who we recognize from standing in the crowd outside the ring. A hush falls over gym as Wheeler stares Adonis down with silent confidence. Danny steps into the ring, and straps up his gloves, whil Adonis bends down and puts his mouthpiece in. Adonis reac out to touch gloves with Wheeler, who knocks them away an moves in quick.  11. Adonis backs up, sends a couple of left jabs. Wheeler duc one, parries the other, and sends a quick flurry back at Adonis. Adonis dodges them but is forced into the ropes i retreat.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: Stop runnin, boy... Adonis reloads, and starts back at Wheeler. He creeps in cautiously, sends two jabs at Wheeler, the first (head) misses, the second (Body) connects. He follows with hook, Wheeler ducks, and comes up with an uppercut, followed by straight shot to Adonis’ forehead. Adonis goes crashing t the matt- ass first. The gym ROARS. He shakes it off and bounces up to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay down... He stands back up, gets into his stance, and moves in on Wheeler who cages up, and leans on the ropes, blocking Ad shots with his arms.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ready, rich boy? Wheeler strikes back with two quick jabs to Adonis’ face, sidesteps Adonis’ counter and lands a left hook to the gu that doubles him over. Then WHAM! He slams a right hook i Adonis’ face, reopening his wound. Adonis drops to one knee, trying to find his bearings.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay down! Adonis stands up, trying to shake the hit off, and bangs gloves together. He puts his hands up to fight again. He at Wheele, swinging wildly. Wheeler ducks the shots, then slams a left uppercut into his body, then sends a right cross, knocking his mouthpiece out.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go down! Adonis, nearly out on his feet, puts his hands up to keep fighting. He takes another swing. Wheeler evades easily a bangs another punch into Adonis’ jaw. He stumbles back, a chokes on something, then spits out a bloody molar.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go down.  18 12. He puts his hands back up, and moves in Wheeler, barely o balance. He swings hard, but Wheeler slips him, and conne with a stiff left to his face, sending him crashing to th mat.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: FADE IN- ADONIS’ POV WHILE LAYING ON HIS BACK IN THE RING

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Wheeler picking up Adonis’ cash. - Other fighters giving Wheeler pats on his back. - Duke standing over Adonis- looking at him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Get the medic... INT. DUKE’S OFFICE 18 The MEDIC (Black, 60’s) has just finished stitching up Adonis’ eye and heads out of the room. Duke walks in and down across from Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why won’t you help me, man.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Besides you disrespecting me in my own gym?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I gotta get your attention somehow.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You got it, and you’ve got my answer.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Then I’1l go to somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: It’s not gonna matter. I promised your grandmother that I’d do everything in my power to keep you from boxing. And that’s what I’m gonna do. (beat) Now you want to go out to Mexico and get yourself killed in one of those bar fights, I can’t control that. But around here, my word is law.  19 13. Adonis looks at Duke. DUKE (CONT’D) All that aside, kid. You’re not even that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne sits on the couch, sipping from a glass, and smiling at the television. ON THE SCREEN- a home video of the Creed family, circa 19

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Grandma! Adonis storms into the living room, and turns off the TV. Mary Anne gives him a look that could kill as he sits dow next to her.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need you to call Duke.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: I just got off the phone with him. He told me Wheeler tore you a new one.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I need you to call him and tell him to train me.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Must be your concussion talking.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You going behind my back telling people not to touch me? That stops today.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: A woman protects her family. Even from themselves.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m a grown man. This is what I want to do with my life.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you want. Look at your face. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t tell you how many times I had to sit up feeding Appolo because his eyelids were swollen shut. Or wiping his ass because he couldn’t move his arms. Apollo gave his life, so you wouldn’t have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Oh, so that’s why he took that last fight? Mary Anne cuts Adonis a cold look.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He didn’t need the money. Why'd he do it? Maybe he was sick of being cooped up in this house with your controlling ass- WHAP! Mary Anne slaps the taste out of his mouth. Adonis turns his head back to her for a beat, then storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis is surrounded by the success of his grandfather Ap Creed. His eyes track the framed items on the walls: Apol American Flag Shorts, championship belts, humanitarian awards, and pictures shaking hands with Presidents. His e fall on a newspaper article with a picture of Apollo and Rocky Balboa the clipping reads, “CREED TRAINS FORMER RIV He goes over to a cabinet underneath the newspaper clippi and digs through a box. He takes an unseen object and sto out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis looks at the Wikipedia page for Rocky Balboa on hi iPAD. He taps the link to Adrian’s, website “CONTACT”. Th address is in Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive hands pick up a worn, paperback romance novel off display rack. The hands belong to ROCKY BALBOA (60's, Ita American). He looks at the cover, through his glasses, an mouths along to the title. He slaps the book down on the checkout counter.  23 24 25 26 15.

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’1l be all champ?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yup. Till next time. (touches his stomach) You think I could use your bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Rocky, leaning up against the walls of the stall, vomi into the toilet. He stands up, wipes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky exits the store, book in tow headed towards his industrial, white van parked on the sidewalk. He crosses street towards a corner-store

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky walks up to the CLERK (40’s Palestinian), eyeing th liquor on display behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin. Let me get a little bottle of Four Roses. The clerk grabs a pint of the cheap stuff, puts it in a p bag, and sits it on the counter in front of Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Gonna have to see some ID, champ. Rocky smiles as he counts out $15 and hands it over. The clerk tries to give him change back, but Rocky declines i EXT. CEMETERY- ADRIAN’S PLOT-— DUSK 26 The bouquet sits next to ADRIAN BALBOA’s headstone. Rocky sits in a chair across from it, glasses on, reading the b outloud. He comes to the end of the chapter, dog ears the page and closes the book. He stands up, hides his folding chair in the a tree, and starts off. He stops at another headstone, and pulls the bottle of Fo Roses out of the bag, and sits it down, unopened on the tombstone. We see it reads “PAULIE PENNINO” 1940-2012. Ro heads off towards his car.  27 28 16. INT. CALIFORNIA MEN’S COLONY- SAN LOUIS OBISPO 27 We find Adonis, waiting in a line of visitors going throu processing. Guards look on, past the metal detectors, as Adonis places his personal items in the X-Ray machine tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis sits down in a row of plastic chairs on the visito side of the glass panel. Several visits are going on on either side of him, with INMATES, speaking with visitors through black phones. A BUZZ is heard, and TERREL JOHNSON (40’s) a man of sligh build but intense eyes, emerges from the prison door and down across from Adonis. They stare at each other through thick glass. He picks up the phone. Adonis picks up his.

dialogues.speaker: TERREL
dialogues.text: Look at you. All that hair on your face. What are you now, 22?
Terrel takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm leaving tomorrow. Going to the East Coast. Not planning on coming back.

dialogues.speaker: TERREL
dialogues.text: That's good. Wish I had some cool advice to give you... but you done outgrew mine.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t come for advice. Just wanted to tell you face to face. Terrel nods.

dialogues.speaker: TERREL
dialogues.text: Did you win? Adonis nods. Terrel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TERREL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll look for you, in the papers, and on ESPN.  29 29 17.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I aint even got nothin’ set up out there. Don’t know if I ever will...

dialogues.speaker: TERREL
dialogues.text: Hey. It aint like I don’t got time.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Alright man.

dialogues.speaker: TERREL
dialogues.text: Aight. They hang up their phones, and stand up on opposite sides the glass. Adonis watches as Terrel heads back to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, stands next to his car and several bags of luggag holding an envelope full of cash. He’s staring at a CRAIGSLIST CUSTOMER (40’s, Hispanic), who sits in the driver's seat. He fires up the engine, tosses a peace sig to Adonis, and drives off into the distance. Kayla runs out of the house towards him and grabs his leg Adonis grabs her back and squeezes her tight. He bends do to her.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Are you ever coming back?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m not sure.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: How will we talk?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: We’ll use the computer.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Are you gonna fight?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You better win. Adonis forces a smile as the cab pulls up. Kayla heads ba towards the house, and he gets in.  30 31 32 33 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commercial plane moves along the horizon, with downtown Philadelphia's skyscrapers looming in the foreground. EXT. ADONIS’ PHILADELPHIA APARTMENT BUILDING 31 A yellow cab lets Adonis out at the corner. He looks up a sparce brick apartment complex. INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT HALLWAY 32 Adonis stands next to his LANDLORD (Filipina, 50s) who fi the keys to his unit.

dialogues.speaker: LANDLADY
dialogues.text: A lot of young people here, students, artists. Not too many families. You’1l like it. Adonis looks down the hallway as a WHITE GUY gets onto th elevator. At the last second a WOMAN (Black, 20’s long dreadlocks, stunning) carrying a subwoofer catches the elevator doors. She gets on, not noticing Adonis staring down as the elevators close. He turns his attention back the Landlady, as she opens his door. Series of shots -Adonis has just finished moving into a studio apartment- It’s modest. Adonis grabs his phone, and exits. -Adonis stands at the top of the Art Museum steps, lookin at the Rocky statue, the sun setting behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky places large boxes onto a rack. FRIEDA, the hostess enters the narrow staircase and near the bottom sees Rock the stove in discussion with the HISPANIC CHEF, and TWO KITCHEN WORKERS.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEDA
dialogues.text: Rocky? Rocky turns towards the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah?  34 19.

dialogues.speaker: FRIEDA
dialogues.text: There’s some guy who wants to talk with ya.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Kinda late...

dialogues.speaker: FRIEDA
dialogues.text: Want me to tell him you already left?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I got it. INT. ADRIAN’S RESTAURANT 34 Upstairs Adonis stares at the many pictures depicting Roc career. On the wall are his title belts too. His eyes settle on a large dynamic painting of Rocky and Apollo, about to exchange blows. Because of the hour, there are only four remaining diners usual, opera music is faintly heard. Adonis hears heavy footsteps coming up the basement stair His eyes travel from the vibrant painting to Rocky appear at the top of the stairs. Rocky removes his glasses as he approaches. Adonis is slightly taken aback by the “present” Rocky, an the colorful youthful image seen on the painting.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin’? (off Adonis’ non- answer) I hear you wanna talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (glancing at the painting) Painting’s cool... who landed first?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: That’s a secret... Rocky notices the stitches.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You a fighter, huh? (off Adonis’ nod) That from a punch or a butt.  20.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Butt.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Terrible feeling, you know? Like ya been kissed by a rock...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I seen a lot of your old fights.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Don’t ya got nothin better to do? What’s ya name?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Adonis. Everybody calls me Donnie though.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Different-

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t pick it. It’s Greco- Roman. My grandfather had a name like that.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: That’s nice-

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I never met him. But you did.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: They say you never really know somebody till you fight them, so you probably knew him better than anybody. Rocky does the math, while Adonis looks back towards the painting.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Where you say you were from, kid?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Los Angeles. Rocky stares.  35 21.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Apollo? Apollo’s your GRANDfather?! Wait, he had two little girls and..

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Little Lisa? You’re Lisa’s kid? Has it been that long... Rocky smiles and covers his hand with his mouth. He can’t believe it. Then it hits him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing fighting? Adonis looks around for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You think we could sit down somewhere and talk?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN'S RESTAURANT- LATER 35
dialogues.text: Everyone is gone, only the back lights are on. Rocky and Adonis sit at a table. Rocky drinks wine, Adonis water.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Apollo was something that was like invented. Had all the good stuff, heart, brains, power, forget it. Hit so hard, you felt like you were on a rocket to planet pain. And he had this mental thing... called it “The Eye of The Tiger”

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Eye of the Tiger? Sounds corny.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Corny? It saved my life. The hunger, the drive. He could make things happen out of nothing. He’d be loosing, then BAM, one shot, one special move, now he’s won- it was magic.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Then how’d you beat him?  He’s ata 22.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It was just my time. He had won fifty fights. Nobody stays strong forever. (beat) So why’d you come here?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I want you to train me.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Train ya? I’m no trainer.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Be my teacher, then. Why should I have to go to some other lame, when we could keep it in the family.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Family? Well... loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You gotta miss it...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Miss it? No. I got it all outta my system, and I don’t look back.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why’d you do it in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I had nothin. Less than nothin.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: And it gave you something, right? And I’m not talking about the money.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah it gave me something. But it made me loose a lot of things too. That's the thing about boxing, it takes more than it gives, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Can say that about life. (beat) Look, it’s something inside of me, telling me I gotta do this. But I’m missing something that can take me to the next level. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think that’s you. You can show me how to do it right.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Y’know- Apollo died in my hands. I watched my friend die, knowing I shoulda stopped it. That was what it was; now you’re here. I don’t want it. He wouldn’t either. Adonis takes this in. Digs into his bag and pulls out a V tape. He sits it down in front of Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Brought you this, check it out, if you still got something that can play it. Adonis stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1ll be at your old gym tomorrow. Check me out if you feel up to it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Sold that place, haven’t been there in years. He starts towards the door, and on his way out he stops b the painting again.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: So who landed first?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Figures... Adonis exits as Rocky stares after the departing young ma trying to make sense of it all. 36 INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT- NIGHT 36 Adonis lays on his back in his bed struggling to sleep as LOUD music can be heard in the room above his head. He pulls the pillow from over his ear, and looks up at th ceiling.  37 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, now wearing a T shirt and shorts, knocks on the d that the music is coming from. After a beat, the music st The door opens, but is stopped by the security chain, and BIANCA (20's, Black, dreadlocks) peeks her head out and l at Adonis with a confused look. Adonis looks back caught guard. It’s not who he expected to be there. She looks at him, eyebrows raised. Adonis snaps out of it

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I just moved in downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I can hear your music through the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Oh! You must be right under me.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: That unit’s been empty for a while... Got used to it.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I gotta workout early in the morning... so.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Gotchu. You gotta wake up early and do ya jawns. (mimes doing pushups) Keep your body tight... I’11 turn the bass waay down you won’t hear a peep. Bianca closes the door, almost in Adonis’ face.  38 39 40 4l 25. INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT— MOMENTS LATER 38 Adonis lays down on his back looking up at the ceiling. T music still plays, but so quietly that he has to strain t hear it. EXT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- MORNING 39 On the same street Rocky’s row house blends in with all t others. The door leading to the tiny back yard open, and Rocky exits. Dressed in modest, out of style clothing, an old sweatshirt, he sits down on the top step and looks at incredibly old, cracked heavy bag that still hangs from i rusted chain. He sips coffee from a mug and thinks. INT. MICKEY’S GYM- DAY 40 Several FIGHTERS warm up inside. Adonis walks past a smal SIX YEAR OLD fighter sitting at the edge of the ring, put on his hand wraps. Adonis turns to the larger ring, where LEO “THE ASSASSIN” SPORINO JR. (20's Italian American) works drills with his father “PISTOL” PETE SPORINO (40s Italian) who still look like he may have a couple of fights left in him. Above th ring a large banner reads “2012 Golden Gloves Champion Le “THE ASSASSIN” Sporino Jr. . Leo’s entourage looks on. INT. MICKEY’S GYM- MOMENTS LATER 4l Adonis and Sporino talk ringside, between rounds.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: The membership is $50 dollars a month. You get unlimited access to the gym, and all the equipment. You with a trainer?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: You amateur?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Pro.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Where you from?  42 43 26.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Hollywood! (beat) Which gym? I know all those guys. This stops Adonis in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: More self taught than anything.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Self taught... pro... (long beat) Well most members just work themselves out. For an extra $20 a month. I can give you drills, and check in with you when I can. You want to do that? Adonis nods. MOMENTS LATER- We find Adonis in the corner, doing step a punch on air, next to the six year old fighter, and a cou of other young BOXERS. He looks over at Leo working drill envious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis walks down the sidewalk, looking around, questioni if he made the right move coming out to Philly. As he approaches a building, he sees a line of hipsters, mostly black standing outside. Hip- Hop music plays from inside. He keeps walking: not his type of crowd, but as h passes the window, he sees that stops him in his tracks. looks back at the line, and heads towards it. The camera tracks over to reveal a large flyer with a photo of Bianc it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, holding a beer, stands in the back of the crowd watching Bianca finish up her set.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: This last song, is for anyone who has ever had their heart broken.  44 27. The HOUSE BAND starts, and Bianca closes her eyes, moving the beat. She sings, with a beautiful edge to her voice. Adonis watches her closely, she opens them and they seem catch eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis watching the musicians packing up. We see his POV: Bianca giving the guitarist a hug. She walks over to the and the BARTENDER hands over her purse from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Wussup, neighbor. Bianca looks up and sees Adonis, recognizing him immediat She turns back to her purse. Putting the pack of cigarett back inside.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Workout boy. I thought that was you. Adonis smiles this off.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Nice show.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: (disinterested) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah... Can I buy you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Wussup, you don’t drink?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I drink. I’m just not drinking with you.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Cause I know your type.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: My type?  28.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: The type who hits the gym in the morning and picks up broads in bars at night. She's got him, he tries to regroup.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m not trying to pick you up, I’m extending an olive branch... Last night, I didn’t know you were...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Working?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) And I don’t just go to the gym for the hell of it... I’m a boxer. Bianca looks at him for a quick beat.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: A boxer, like pro?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I thought boxers weren’t supposed to drink. Adonis looks down at his cup.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m off the clock.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Oh... (checks the time on her phone) Well I’m not... see you around. She heads off.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Wait... She's already too far to hear him. Adonis looks down at h drink, then around the club.  45 46 47 48 49 29. INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT— NIGHT 45 Adonis sits on his back, video chatting with Kayla on his iPAD. He says goodnight to her and hangs up. Just as Bian music starts up again. Adonis listens for a bit. Then giv up on any chance of sleeping, and rolls out of bed and st doing pushups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a PACKED HOUSE- a sellout crowd has gathered the aro the weigh- in stage. A banner reads: PORTER VS WHEELER: FIGHT OF THE CENTURY. Wheeeler and Porter, wearing only b briefs, approach each other for the stare down. Nose to n the two mumble threats at each other, until Porter pushes forehead against Wheeler’s face. Wheeler gives him a hard shove back and, WHAM! Porter cracks Wheeler across his fa with a right, crumpling him. A melee breaks out as both c descend on each other. FREEZE FRAME ON THE CHAOS

dialogues.speaker: ESPN ANCHOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was the scene earlier today at the weigh in for the Porter- Wheeler fight. INT. MICKEY’S GYM- DAY 47 We pull back to reveal Adonis and a few other patrons watching Sportscenter in between rounds.

dialogues.speaker: ESPN ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Wheeler, who suffered a broken jaw in the fight, and has already announced plans to sue both Porter, and the WBC. Adonis goes back over to the heavy bag, and works drills from all of the action of Sporino, Leo, and their entoura INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT- NIGHT 48 Adonis paces his apartment, bored. Bianca’s music can be heard from upstairs. He walks over to his kitchen and loo inside of the refrigerator- nothing but bachelor food. He looks up at his ceiling. INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT HALLWAY- 49 Adonis knocks on Bianca’s door. This time she doesn’t sto the music, and just opens the door and stares at him blan  30.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’ve been hearing you up here working for a while. (beat) I was wondering if, you wanted to grab a bite? Bianca looks at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You asking me out on a date? Or are you extending another olive branch?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I'm asking you if you’re hungry. (beat) I know how I am when I’m focused. Sometimes I forget to eat... It’s not a date... Bianca stares at him. Then looks back into her room.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I can’t do more than an hour. Where did you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I was hoping you could tell me. Maybe we go somewhere in your hood.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: My hood? (beat) You sure you ready for that? Adonis nods. Bianca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis follows Bianca closely as they walk towards a florescent soaked Chinese Food Restaurant on a gritty, graffiti stained street corner. Several young, tough looking, kids stand outside on the street, staring Adonis down.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Where are we right now?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: West Philly.  31.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: So this is why the Fresh Prince's mom sent him to Bel Air. Bianca chuckles at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a gritty restaurant. Graffiti stained windows, mostl African- American patrons, Chinese American staff serves register. We find Bianca and Adonis sitting down near a window, tea into their food with their chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I been coming to this jawn since I was a kid. My parents own a store a couple blocks over. She scrapes pieces of general chicken onto his plate.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What’s a jawn?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Jawn... that’s Philly for anything. (Pointing out each item of food) See these, is jawns. These is jawns. That shirt you’re wearing, that’s a jawn. Adonis smiles at his cultural tour guide.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You got a dude? Bianca shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Too much going on right now. Don't have the time.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Booking a lot of shows? Bianca nods.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Need about 5 a month just to pay the rent. Also making a ton of music. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tryna finish this EP by next week. Got a shot at opening for Rihanna

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Word, is that a big one?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Huge, all the big acts from here played there first. Jill, Legend, the Roots...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: That’s wussup!

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: It’s a long shot.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I got faith in you. (beat) How long have you been singing?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Since I was young... how long have you been boxing?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I've been boxing pro for like two years. Bianca looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You don’t seem like a boxer to me. You look like one, you know... but ain’t most boxer’s like...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Street? Not saying you’re a square... but how’d you get into to doing this? Adonis looks at her for a long beat. Deciding whether or to tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I had a lot of anger issues when I was young. Something about boxing always calmed me down. She looks at him, seeing him a bit differently now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you come out here?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I got like an uncle out here who was a real dope boxer. Trying to get him to train me.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want to? Adonis shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You seem pretty convincing to me. I think you'll get him to come around.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Just be honest with him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What do you mean.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Do you want him to train you because him he was a good boxer... or do you want him to train you because he’s your family?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Because he’s my family, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Come at him like that. Adonis thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: When is your next show? I wanna come and support.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You don’t gotta do that.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Too late. First show was too dope... I’m a groupie now. Bianca smiles at Adonis for a bit, trying to figure him o He looks down at the food, noticing its all gone.  34.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well. Should we blow this jawn? Bianca nods and they get up.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BUS- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Adonis and Bianca sit next to each other on the bus ridin back. Bianca falls asleep. Adonis slowly puts his arm aro her. Just as it touches her, she wakes up, and he subtly plays it off. He smiles. 53 INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT HALLWAY- 53 Adonis walks Bianca to the door of her apartment. Bianca stops at her door and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Thanks for the food. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You gonna work some more?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I’1ll use the headphones, don’t worry.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Naw, I was gonna see if it was cool to come in and listen.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Ha. You move fast, don’t you? Adonis smiles, taking the loss.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I only got one gear... Good night.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Nite. She opens the door and goes inside. Adonis heads down the hall. Bianca pops back out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Oh, Donnie.  35.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I need your government. For the guest list. I gotta a show Friday night at the Luxe. No pressure. Adonis pauses for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Adonis Johnson. Bianca chuckles at this.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Seriously? That’s a practical joke of a name. Might as well be named Guapo.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Don’t. My mom had me young. It’s a long story.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Alright, Adonis. I'll put you down.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: See you then. 54 INT. RING MICKEY’S GYM- DAY 54 TITO (Hispanic, 20s), Leo’s sparring partner stands in th corner of the ring where CUT MEN attempt to stop his nose from bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: TITO
dialogues.text: I can still go...

dialogues.speaker: CUT MAN
dialogues.text: We can’t stop it.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Jesus. Take him out of here... (looks around for another person) Hollywood! Adonis looks up. SPORINO (CONT’D) (under his breath to Leo) Says he’s pro... (to Adonis) Let’s go, it’s your lucky day.  55 56 57 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis adjusts his headgear, trying to warm up. In the ot corner, Leo stands already good to go. The bell sounds, and the fighters head towards each other Adonis comes out with a lot of bounce, evasive but Leo, focused and methodical, quickly cuts the ring off on him begins to punish him with jabs and hooks to the body. INT. MICKEY’S GYM- BACK 56 A door unlocks and opens in the back corner of the gym, a from the commotion of the ring, and Rocky steps in keys i hand. He’s dressed even more modestly than usual, as he w towards the commotion of the sparring match, hanging back out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis is leaning up against the ropes, his back to Rocky caged up against an all out barrage of hooks from Leo.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: C’mon Hollywood, lets see that West Coast swag. He leans back on the ropes and counters, the first one la but Leo ducks the second and lands a three hit combo on Adonis’ head. The last one sending him to a knee. Leo backs off holding his hands up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Pro, what? Get me another one, pops! Adonis tries to shake off the blow, and he looks outside ring and catches eyes with, Rocky. Who looks back at Adon with a worried look. Almost on- sight, Adonis stands up. bangs his gloves together.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Come’ on. I thought philly was tough, them love taps, boy! Leo turns around to Adonis. Rage in his eyes. He comes at Adonis swinging hard. Adonis ducks the punches, and count with two hard left jabs to his nose, each one snapping hi head back. Leo stumbles back, then counters with a hook t Adonis’ gut.  58 37. The round buzzer sounds and Adonis backs off, but Leo com forward wanting more. Blood trickles out of his left nost

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Come’ on! Sporino comes into the ring and quickly steps between the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Hollywood, you’re good for the day. He grabs Leo’s face, looking at his nose.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Naw, let us keep rockin.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Chill out. What are you gonna have World War III in a sparring session... Adonis turns back to where Rocky was standing, and finds: one. He bites at his glove tape, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is seen turning out the lights, then exits. He begi to cross the street when he hears a familiar voice.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why’d you leave?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Whatya doin out here?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Taking a walk... that was you at the gym, right?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah that was me. Had to get back to some things here.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you stay.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I had seen enough. (beat) Seeing you take punches in there, brought back memories. Not so good ones, you know?  38.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What was I doing wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... (beat) Off the top of my head... you can’t lean on the ropes against a fighter like that... tall like. You drop your weight, and spin keeping him close. Go right through him. Adonis looks at Rocky for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: See... that’s what I’m talking about... You’ve got all this knowledge in there... (points to Rocky’s head) but you sell spaghetti? Walk around here like a ghost? Rocky looks down.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mickey... he trained you right? And my grandpa, and Duke? It’s selfish of you not to give back. Especially with us being like family.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Why you keep saying that, kid.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Family... we just met.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: But you and my grandpa was like brothers right? Rocky sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He died and left me with a bunch of people that don’t get me. But I think he would have. And I know you do.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t get you, kid. Boxings the worst sport there is. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: People slap you on the back, telling ya how great you are, but up them three steps... scariest place in the world. Just you, and another guy who wants to bury you. You don’t want that to be your life. (beat) It’s for people whose lives can’t get no worse. People with no choices. (beat) Just talking to you, I can tell you're smart. Ya got choices kid. Adonis quickly moves closer to Rocky. Almost sizing him u

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Look at me. Rocky postures a bit.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, I’m looking at you.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Look in my eyes. Adonis moves even closer, the two standing off, like two fighters before a 12 round bout.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You talk about choices. I made my choice. I’m need this. Tell me you don’t see it in my eyes. They stare each other down for a beat. Adonis turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (without turning around) Watch that tape, man... He heads off down the street, leaving Rocky with his thoughts. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- BASEMENT 59 It’s what’s left of Rocky’s man- cave. Mostly a storage space. Rocky sits on an old incline weight bench, in fron the small television and VCR.  60 40. We see that he is looking down at the tape that Adonis ga him. He takes a deep breath, turns the television on and the tape into the VCR. ON THE SCREEN- Grainy footage of the televised first figh between Apollo Creed and Rocky. The tape picks up the fig between rounds, close- up footage

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ROCKY
dialogues.text: Who looks at the footage, almost as if watching people he doesn’t recognize. We hear the bell, and the round begins subtle memory comes over his eyes. He stands up, parallel with his younger self in the fight, and starts to mirror old movements... INT. MICKEY’S GYM- NEXT MORNING 60 Sporino takes Leo through a weightlifting routine in the corner of the gym. He looks up at the entrance and notice Rocky, walking through the door. And people aklowledging presence.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Champ.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin. The two embrace.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Didn't know you were comin’ by.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Me either. Place looks okay.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Yeah I do what I can. Sporino calls Leo over.

dialogues.speaker: SPORNIO
dialogues.text: Here's my kid I was telling you about. I don’t know if you guys ever had a chance to meet, but he’s the next big thing outta here. (sotto voce) Option’s still open, should you want to get involved... Leo and Rocky shake hands.  41.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: It’s an honor, champ. Rocky spots Adonis stepping out of the dressing room, alr sweating from hours of training. He spots Rocky talking t Sporino and Leo.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Unc. Rocky lifts his head at Adonis. Sporino and Leo’s snap around. Their jaws hit the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Was in the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: How do you know Hollywood?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: It’s Donnie... And I’m a good friend of the family.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: You guys working together?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know... (to Rocky) Are we? Rocky shrugs. An uncomfortable silence between the four o them.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: You guys let me know if you need anything. He and Leo head back over to the weights, staring at Rock and Adonis. Rocky and Adonis start towards the bags.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell them who you are? Adonis shakes his head.  61 42.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna go broadcasting that. Keep it between us, you know. Rocky nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So, you ready to roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A. Dawn- we see the dun rising in the mist, over the industrial landscape of Philadelphia. B. Schuykill River- Dawn. We see Adonis running along the majestic river. Vapor expels from his mouth on this brisk morning. We see Rocky watching from a vantage point along adjacent road. Behind him is the van.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Keep up the pace!! As Adonis moves on, the city outline is seen looming befo him. c. Int. Gym Rocky is seen holding the bag as Adonis pounds away. Unde the music we can faintly hear Rocky giving instructions.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A hundred a round. Sporino looks on, as does Leo who shadow boxes in front o stained mirror. D. Adonis has just completed wrapping his knees as he lea up from the floor to the 2nd step leading into the boxing ring. He does this repetitively as Rocky keeps count. E. Bianca’s Concert Adonis stands in the front row, while Bianca rocks the cr She eyes him as she performs. F. Rocky Home Rocky is again studying the old film of he and Apollo box It seems to re affirm his belief in Apollo and his grands G. Int. Gym  43. Rocky has Adonis performing an unusual task. Hitting the heavy bag with his shoulders, no hands. Adonis is drippin sweat. H. Ext. Street- night It is quite cold as Adonis runs through the deserted Sout Philly marketplace. He passes by Rocky, who stands beside van. I. Hogie shop- Night. Adonis stands with Bianca as they have their cheese steak dinner in the famous Pat’s Cheesesteaks. People watch as share bites of each other’s sandwiches and share a playfu kiss. J. Int. Gym Adonis is doing one arm pushups in the ring. People look especially Sporino and Leo.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: When we gonna spar?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: When ya ready, K. Int. Bianca’s Apartment- night The clock reads 4:15am as she looks out the window... dow below she sees Adonis getting into Rocky’s van and depart L. Ext. Deserted Backyard- Morning Adonis looks at a pait of chickens standing nervously in front of him and Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Man, seriously?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Old school- go! Adonis starts after the fleeing chickens, and surprisingl quickly snatches one up.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Old schools out!  62

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Chickens are slowing down... INT. MICKEY’S GYM- TWO WEEKS LATER 62 Adonis, now wearing his gloves, throws the left jab again weathered, horizontal heavy bag. Rocky stands behind him, watching the impact of each punc The end of round bell sounds. Adonis sits down, trying to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You rest on your feet. He pops up as Sporino approaches Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Kid’s lookin’ good.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: We got a ways to go... Adonis walks over.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: (to Adonis) Whattya weigh right now?

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: (to Rocky) If he could get down to a buck 75 in a month, we might be able to put something together (to Adonis) If you’re interested that is.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, I’m interested-

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (to Adonis) Hey, you do the fightin’ alright? Rocky walks Sporino out of earshot of Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You talkin about going up against your kid?  63 45.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: He could use a fight to keep warm. And people will come out to see you in the corner again. We could get it done at the Blue Horizon. Make a few bucks for everybody. Rocky thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m just starting to get used to this kid being around, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Yeah but he’s hungry. Let him eat. Think about it, Rock. Lemmie know by tomorrow. Sporino pats Rocky on the shoulder and walks away. EXT. MICKY’S GYM- DUSK 63 Adonis and Rocky, just finishing up their workouts, walk towards Rocky’s van.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You don’t think I can beat him?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He fought golden gloves, open class an won it-

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I fought a guy who won gloves in Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You win?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Close enough... (beat) Things get rough in Mexico, trust me. With you training me, I know I can take this guy, Unc. Trust me. (Italian Gangster voice) Let me make you an offer you can’t refuse. Rocky shakes his head at this.  46.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We take this match. And I got six weeks to get in shape. I’1l do whatever it takes, and if at the end of six weeks, you don’t think I’m ready: call it off. Rocky scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t fly 3,000 miles from home to play around. This is what I’m here for. I'll go 24/7 with this shit. Matter of fact, we can stop playing around, we can go to crib throw all my stuff in the van right now.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: We can take it to your place. That’s how camp is right? You live with the trainer... old school. Let's go, right now.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Slow down. It’s been some time since there’s been other people at the house, since my Brother- In Law passed away. Might be uncomfortble for ya.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Is it haunted?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Course not.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I'll be alright then, let’s roll. EXT. ADONIS’ PHILADELPHIA APARTMENT 64 Rocky sits in the driver’s seat while Adonis loads the la of his stuff into the back. He walks around the sidewalk looks up at Bianca, who sits in her second story bedroom window watching him.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t need any help? I’1ll put these guns to use.  47. She flexes her biceps. Adonis smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Done now.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: (sarcastiacally) Darn. Adonis knocks on the hood of the car. Getting Rocky’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Come meet my... my neighbor. Rocky gets out of the van and takes a look at Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin- somebody forgot to gimmie ya name. Rocky walks over to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Bianca, this is my Uncle I was telling you about. Bianca squints her eyes at Rocky for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: He’s White...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, there is that... Bianca points at Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Holy shit... are you Rocky Balboa!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Listen I’m just helpin’ him out. Anytime you wanna drop in, if he aint trainin it’1l be okay.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’1l call you.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Yeah... I won’t hold my breath... She flashes a smile, Rocky blows her a kiss, and does a p bow. Adonis throws her a peace sign.  65 66 67 48. She playfully rolls her eyes and closes the window on him They jump in the van and blast off. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- NIGHT 65 Adonis and Rocky move boxes into a vacant room. Rocky struggles with one, grows tired and sits it down.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (rubs his back) You don’t ever want a bad back.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I got it Adonis picks up where Rocky left off. He comes out of the room and sees photos and signs of Paulie everywhere. Old booze bottles, bar signs, and vintage Playboys mags.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This your brother- law’s room? Rocky nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Paulie. Adonis looks at the sagging bed.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Guess he spent alot of time in here. Adonis leaps on it, and stretches out.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still comfy though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the city. A garbage man collects trash the street corner. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- ADONIS’ ROOM- EARLY MORNING 67 Adonis sleeps in a bed in the spare bedroom. THE SPINNERS plays from old record player speakers, pumped to the max. Adonis snaps up and checks his phone: 3:45am. He looks up see Rocky, fully dressed singing and dancing along to the music.  68 69 49. EXT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- ASS CRACK OF DAWN 68 Rocky and Adonis walk up to the van.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m taking you to another gym in North Philly. Tough joint. Very difficult. They take no crap there. Kinda what Apollo did with me. Rocky gets in. Adonis tries the passenger side door and i doesn’t open. Adonis knocks on the window, Rocky rolls it down.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Can ya unlock the door?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You're gonna run. I’m antique, so I'll just be drivin’ along side keepin company.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: How far away is the new gym?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Close enough. He fires up the engine, and starts rolling down the stree Adonis runs along side of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is the roughest that we have seen so far. The GUY are already in there working. We find Rocky introducing Adonis (who looks like he just a marathon) to his team: JOE HAND III (50s, Black, Owns t gym), AMIR HAND (20's, Black, Joe’s Son same build as Adonis), MARCEL (60s, HISPANIC, short and stocky, glasses They size Adonis up with excitement. Rocky points to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: This is Joe. We go way back. Spared a little, fought some of the best. Got alotta knowledge in here. Joe shakes hands with Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Champ told me a lot about you. Excited to help get you ready. (points to Marcel) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Marcel, the best cut man in Philly. (points to Amir) And this my son, Amir, who’s gonna be helping you out with sparring. Adonis shakes hands with Marcel and Amir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Adonis work the hand bags, while Amir, Joe, and Marcel look on. Adonis punches from a flamboyant stance, hands low. Every so many punches, Rocky swings at Adonis’ head with the hand bags. But Adonis ducks and dodges out the way, leaving Rocky just missing him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hands up... Keep your hands up! Rocky swings on him again, fast as he can, but still miss Adonis smiles. Rocky stops.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Amir. Amir jogs over.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Sup Rock? Rocky takes off the hand bags, and hands them to Amir. He subtly leans forward to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m takin a break. (sotto voce) Yo, Make him keep his hands up, know what I mean? Amir nods. And walks over to Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Same drill, but forget gravity, and keep em up, even higher. They start. The pace of the drill is twice as fast as it with Rocky, then Amir swings, and WHAM! he catches Adonis the side of the face with the handbag. Adonis cuts Amir a look.  51.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Nobody said stop and give looks. Let’s go! They start again, and WHAM! Adonis is caught again even harder this time.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (threatening) Watch my eye, bruh!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You supposed to watch your own eye. Keep movin! The drill starts again and after a few exchanges, Amir sw once, Adonis ducks it but when he comes up he is caught b another swing, SMACK right into his left eye. Adonis explodes, and shoves Amir in his chest, sending hi back fifteen feet.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I told you homie! Take the gloves off! Adonis rips off his gloves and squares up with Amir, who stares at him like he’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go homie! Amir looks at Rocky and at his Dad, and calmly takes the off his hands. He hands them to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Call me when this dude is ready to train, man. Amir heads over to the other side of the gym. Rocky pulls Adonis to the other side of the gym.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, what the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: That dude is trying to take real shots at me, I don’t play that shit.  52.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Y'know, ya tell people stuff like, don't touch that fire, cause it burns. And lo and behold, they do it anyway. Guess what, some people just gotta learn the hard way. Now this Leo guy aint superman, but he’s got fast combos that will punch holes in ya face, if ya don’t keep ya hands up! Adonis takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now go apologize to him. Adonis looks off.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Apologize to him, now, or I walk. Adonis takes a long beat, then begrudgingly walks over to Amir.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: My bad bro, I took a nasty butt to my eye, never healed right.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: It’s all good, bro, happens to the best of us. Just keep them jawns up when you roll, like this. Amir shows Adonis what he is talking about. Adonis mirror it.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I’1l watch the eye.

dialogues.speaker: JOE HAND
dialogues.text: You two kiss and make up? (beat) Now back to work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Series of shots with Rocky talking over them.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Keep reversing them gears- you keep coming forward. Be outside, then close the gap. Be ready to jump in his pocket!  72 53. Adonis shadow boxes with Amir, both wearing hand wraps. A on their feet as they step, replace and pivot with large rubber bands binding their ankles together. Adonis hits the heavy bag.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good, straighter. Work that Jab! Every fighter must have a jab! Stich and hook, catch a punch and let a punch go, nail the guy... Adonis spars with Amir

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close that fist! Close it, good or you're slappin, and slappin don’t cut it! Adonis and Amir shadow box.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything is impossible without footwork!!! In and out, side to side, back and forth, it’s what will take you in for the kill, and take you out of trouble. Adonis punches at the mirror, 51lb dumbbells in each hand Adonis works the heavy bag, throwing three jabs and then right. Rocky and Joe look on.

dialogues.speaker: JOE HAND
dialogues.text: Okay shape, damn fast hands. But I don’t know what’s in here yet (points at his chest) Don’t know about that at all.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, Amir, and Marcel head out, calling it a night. Rocky Adonis are still hard at work. Adonis throws punches at Rocky, who wears focus mitts on each hand, and a body bag

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You gotta bring it back to protect! Bring it back!  73 54. The end of round buzzer goes off.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice, take a break. Adonis is gassed. Rocky, starts to exit the ring, but sta to feel sick. He goes over to the garbage can, and dry heaves.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Unc, you alright?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I'm fine, keep working. Adonis doesn’t. Rocky turns away from the can, and starts back towards him and his leg seem to give out from under Smack! He falls down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Shit! Adonis sprints over.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? Rocky, pissed with himself, nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just a little dizzy. Comes and goes, no big deal, really.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Naw man. That shit didn’t look right, we’re going to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: The doctor for what? Adonis helps Rocky to his feet with his free hand. Rocky stands up, but his leg gives out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky sits on the edge of the hospital bed in a gown. He looks pissed off. Adonis leans up against the wall across from him. The door opens and DR. SHAHANI (mid 30s, Indian woman) wa in holding a clipboard.  55.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa! How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Nervous. When is the doc coming in? Adonis makes a face like he’s about to see a car accident

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Actually, I am the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Sorry. (to Adonis) Doctors have changed. She turns to Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: And you are...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: His nephew. I was just here to make sure he didn’t sneak out of the window before you showed up. (beat) I'll be outside. Dr. Shahani chuckles at this. Rocky doesn’t. Adonis leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: So what brings you in to us?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Probably nothin- The kid saw me get sick, and sorta fall a little. Dr. Shahani nods at this.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Was that the first time you’ve fallen? Rocky shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any other symptoms?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Get tired sometimes, but that’s normal in life, right?  74 56.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Your appetite? Rocky shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Medium... I would say.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Well you have a history of head trauma. And some of the symptoms you describe are consistent with dimentia pugilistica. (off Rocky’s look) But what has me worried is the loss of appetite, and the vomiting. We should run some tests.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m sure you got allotta people really needin your help. I’m good, really. You should check out somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: I believe we should do it now, just to be on the safe side.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Gotta be fast, okay? Me and that kid, we got allota work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis sits in the waiting room asleep. Rocky walks in wi slight limp (from the muscle biopsy). He wakes Adonis up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: All done kid. Let’s go. Adonis pops up.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Shit. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: We going home?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No, we're going to the gym.  75 76 57. They walk side by side, down the hospital hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is electric in the packed house. Two welterweight boxers move around in the ring. It is an intimately desig space, with an upper level of rowdy fans, that seems to s right on top of the ring. The crowd is mixed, mostly Black and Italian though, and standing room only. We reveal that we are looking at the gym from Adonis’ POV stares out beyond the door of his locker room.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: One more. Adonis turns back into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis squares up with Rocky, who takes him through a complicated series of combinations. Adonis nails them wit pinpoint accuracy. Joe, Amir, Marcel, and Bianca look on.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (to Adonis) Listen, what you do here is forever. It’s part of ya history. You can’t change it, so use everything I believe ya got. Keep that jab constantly on him. Hit, and not get hit. Joe, can ya warm him up? Joe hand steps forward with the focus mitts. Rocky glance into the hallway and spots Sporino, who motions for him t come and talk. As Rocky gets closer, we see Sporino looks like the cat who ate the canary.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whats going on?

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: I knew there had to be something with this kid. I mean, I tried to get you to come work with us for years. And this Hollywood kid just brings you out of the shadows?  77 58.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Whattaya gettin at?

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: I made some calls to LA. Aint no Donnie Johnson. Kid’s name is Adonis. Kid’s Creed’s blood. Rocky sighs deeply. SPORINO (CONT’D) (smiling) Fight just got big time...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, the kids tryna make it on his own name. Don’t tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: (without turning around) Secret’s safe with me... Rocky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Leo meet in the middle of the ring, the ref between them, their corners behind them.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
