dialogues.text: Touch em up! Adonis touches gloves with Leo, and heads back to his cor Joe, Amir, and Marcel head out of the ring. Rocky turns b to face Adonis, he grabs him by the face and pulls him cl

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s you now okay? It’s all you, this is what you’ve been waiting for. I’m gonna be right here. Adonis nods, intensely. Rocky steps out of the ring and l back. Adonis turns around, and the SOUND of the crowd fades out a bit, while he looks and sees that only he, Leo, and the referee remain in the ring. Leo looks at Adonis, bouncing looking relaxed and focused. DING! DING! The NOISE of the stadium rushes back as the fighters head towards each other, coming within arms reach right in the middle of the ring. They stop and posture, Leo in perfect stance.  78 59. He throws the first punch, a stiff left jab, Adonis block and sends one back, Leo ducks it and catches Adonis clean with two counters.

dialogues.speaker: SPORINO
dialogues.text: Nice! Nice! Adonis quickly shakes off the hits and grabs him. The ref comes in.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Alright, break it up, break it up. The fighters back up, and then the Ref sends them back at each other. Adonis bounces in on Leo, sends out a couple jabs. Leo blocks all of them, and sends a couple back at Adonis, Adonis ducks the first few and tries to counter w a left Jab, Leo slips it, and gets Adonis into the corner begins sending shot after shot at Adonis. Adonis dodges a of them, and tries to do a hard slip to the right, when B He is caught flush in the side of the head by a left hook from Leo. Adonis is wobbled by this. The crowd explodes a Leo raises his fists to show the crowd that he is about t finish him off.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Tie him up, and bang him on the ropes! Adonis does just that.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The body now! Touch the body! Adonis jabs three times to work his way in. Leo throws a right, which Adonis slips beautifully, and drives a hard left hook to the ribs. Leo emits an audible grunt of pain Leo is hurt, as he spins out, Adonis throws a five punch combo as the bell rings. INT. ADONIS’ CORNER- BLUE HORIZON RING- CONTINUOUS 78 Joe Hand flips the chair over for Adonis to sit down into Adonis sits down and Rocky takes out his mouthpiece. Marc works on the right side of his face with an ice pack.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Very good, what do you think?  79 60.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m gonna move around a little. Till my head clears.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I like what you’re doing. Get ya senses back, then drop ya left below his radar, and come up with a shovel hook. If you see the openin, park ya right on his chin. Your grandfather dropped me with that combo. Works very good. Adonis nods. Rocky puts his mouthpiece back in and Adonis stands up. The team jumps out of the ring. DING! DING! Adonis punches his gloves together and takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Leo approach each other and begin to circling. Adonis keeps his right hand cocked creeps up on Leo with patience. Two quick jabs from Leo, but Adonis slips both of them. H continues to creep in- patient, not bouncing like before. takes a quick jab at Leo, who sidesteps it and reverses h footing, cornering Adonis. He sends rapid shots at Adonis who goes into defense mode, caging up. Leo fakes backing and then comes in with a rapid fire combo. Adonis narrowl slips the hard left of Leo.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Take it! Adonis goes for the combo, dropping his left low, faking right, and brings up the shovel hook, driving Leo’s chin upward, and BANG, a piledriving right lands with audible force. Leo crumbles. Adonis backs off, right hand still cocked as the Ref runs waving his hands, KO. The ref waves his hands- TKO Adonis quickly raises his hands and runs to the corner. R lifts his hands and runs into the ring.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Way to go, kid! That was something!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: We got em, Unc. We got em.  80 81 61. Leo’s team rushes into the ring to aid him. Sporino eyein Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca jumps out of her seat, rushes through the crowd, a into the ring. She embraces Adonis, elated. Leo comes back to his senses.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Whooo, let’s tear this city up! INT. LIVING ROOM- ROCKY’S HOUSE 81 Adonis and Bianca sit on the couch next to Rocky watching SKYFALL. All of them look super sleepy. Bowls of Ice Crea are everywhere. Bianca leans on Adonis’ chest. Rocky does sleepy head droop, then stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna call it a night. Congratulations, kid. He walks down the hallway, and comes back with a blanket he places over Adonis and Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Thanks Unc.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No problem. He goes to the back of the house. Bianca turns to Adonis. whispers.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Hey. Adonis opens his eyes, and looks at Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I made something for you.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Bianca nods.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Close your eyes.  82 62. Adonis closes his eyes. And Bianca pulls out her headphon and places them in his ears. Adonis smiles, tries to peek

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep em closed. She presses play on her phone and a Beautiful, Haunting S starts to play. We hear it as Adonis does, all encompassi Bianca’s voice starts. Adonis keeps his eyes closed affec by this. Bianca watches him closely. Adonis opens his eye And kisses her. She straddles him, keeping their faces cl INT. ROCKY’S KITCHEN- NEXT MORNING 82 Rocky, Adonis and Bianca make breakfast together. The Loc News plays on the TV in the living room. On screen, we se newscaster standing in front of the Blue Horizon Gym.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: Local boxing fans got a blast from the past when Rocky Balboa made a return the ring last night. This time, as a trainer. Balboa was in the corner of Adonis Johnson, an otherwise unknown light heavyweight middleweight, who defeated local bronze medalist Leo Sporino, with a second round TKO. Bianca’s eyes grow wide with excitement, and she rushes i the living room, followed by Rocky and Adonis. LOCAL NEWSCASTER (CONT’D) But things took a dramatic twist on reports that Johnson is the biologic grandson of Apollo Creed the late great heavyweight champion, and close friend of Rocky Balboa. Bianca turns to Adonis, shock in her eyes. Adonis looks b at her- busted. She heads back into the living room and g her things.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Wait. She heads out of the door. Rocky looks on at the news as Adonis follows them out.  83 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca walks briskly while Adonis tries to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Slow down... She walks faster.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Adonis tries to grab her hand, but Bianca pulls away and continues to walk. She goes to the corner and tries to ca a cab. The cab pulls up, Adonis pushes past Bianca and cl the door, telling the driver to take off. Bianca tries to catch another one.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Going home.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why? What you trippin for?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Are you seriously asking me that? (beat) I made love to you last night... and then I turn on the news and find out you've been lying to me. You have any idea how that makes me feel? Do you even care?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t lie to you.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I distinctly remember asking why you're a fighter. That would have been the perfect time to say, “You know, I’m related to the most famous boxer who ever lived...” Adonis searches for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: People look at me different when they know. I didn’t want you looking at me like that.  64.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I’m not people... I don’t care about that kind of shit. I care about you keeping it 100 with me.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Alright. From here on out, 100 percent honest and up front. Just come back to the house with me. Bianca rolls her eyes at this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious! On my grandfather's grave. (beat) We can start right now. Ask me anything.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Anything. Bianca smiles. She can’t help but to be intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: How many girls you been with before me? Adonis winces.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You're different.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Cause I want to be around you all the time. I never felt like that with anybody.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: It’s cause it’s new.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: But it doesn’t feel new. It’s like I’ve known you forever. When I’m close to you, it’s like I can do anything. Bianca crosses her arms, and looks off for a beat.  65.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me you don’t feel the same way. Tell me you don’t and I’11l drive you home myself.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: That's passion, it’s infatuation. That fades.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I can’t see that.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Shit feels too right. You make me want to work hard. Want to win.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: So I’m just a good luck charm?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You could find an insult in a box of roses, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Naw, I just find the real. (beat) It’s cool though. Maybe you’re my good luck charm too. Bianca stares at him. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You do look like him. Adonis quickly points at Bianca’s face, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: See! I knew it! Adonis quickly grabs her by her knees and lifts her up hi into the air inducing a playful shriek. Her phone buzzes. she answers it while Adonis is holding her.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello... Yeah this is she... (to Adonis) Put me down! Put me down!  84 85 66. Adonis obliges. She puts her finger in her ear to hear th phone better.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Of course... Of course... This is foreal, right? Absolutely. Thank you so so much. Bianca hangs the phone up, and takes off running at full speed, screaming in joy. Adonis, confused, sprints after

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What?! What’s going on? She stops and bends over out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I got the gig... You’re looking at the opening act! Adonis screams at the top of his lungs. Bianca jumps onto waist. A TRANSIENT MAN (White, 60s) stares at these two idiots l they’ve lost their minds.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS 84
dialogues.text: -Mary Anne Creed at her house, watching a report on Adoni -Lisa, Daryl, and the Kayla, who promptly puts her hands in celebration. -Terrel in the Rec room, watching the report. -Holiday, in his house in the UK, watching a similar repo INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- DUSK BACKYARD 85 Rocky and Adonis work the hand bags. Adonis sends quick, fluid jabs at Rocky’s hands and stomach. The buzzer goes and Rocky stops, and rubs his sore hands. A plastic kitchen timer goes off. And Adonis stops. Rocky takes off his hand pads and resets the timer.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Relax. I’m on your side.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Everybody knows...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So what? You ashamed or something?  67.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I wanted this on my own.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Who’s in here punchin? Last time I looked at you, you were on ya own. Truthfully, I’m glad this happened. Now everybody’11l be gunnin for you. Makes you very alert. The gym’s buzzer goes off.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time, and this time, don’t break my hands. 86 INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- KITCHEN- CONTINUOUS 86 Rocky walks in and picks up the house phone.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you got this number but...

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Easy, Stallion, it’s Niles Holiday... I used to fight on your undercards, but now represent Ricky Porter.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Wow... Sorry about that... the reporters... you know...

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know how it is... Forgive me for skipping the pleasantries... is it true, about the kid? (off Rocky’s silence) What are you doing tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: We're training.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Think you and the kid can spare 30 minutes for a business meeting? 87 INT. ADRIAN’S-— DAY 87 Daylight streams into the back of the restaurant, that is closed for business for the time being.  68. Rocky Adonis, and Holiday sit around a table.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: My guy has to fight within the next 12 months, and we've beaten everybody. I’ve been at my wits end trying to find somebody worthy of a payday. Until I heard about you two.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You want me to fight Porter? Rocky cuts Adonis a look. Adonis mimes “what?” back at hi Holiday observes this, and moves forward gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: I think it could be a very smart move.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know about that, we’re still working on things.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Good. You were fighting pro fights in Mexico, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: I got you with a record of 11-1-1 out there. Your victory over Sporino’s kid puts you at 12-1. Nobody needs to know those fights were in some bloody hole in the wall. (beat) I’m not saying it isn’t going to be difficult to convince the board. But my camp is in a special position right now.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Curious. How’s your fighter feel about this?

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: He’s thrilled about it. He likes thinking out of the box, giving people chances. You can relate, I’m sure. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure you two are on board with this before we put our weight behind it. We don’t have time to muck about.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: We're game to go- Rocky holds up his hand. Adonis, frustrated stops talking

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What you want me to sit in on the meeting for if I can’t talk.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Talk.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: How soon would this happen?

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: 2 months, 3 max.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (to Rocky) We can do this, right?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Not sure.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Let’s not debate in front of this man.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Look at this chance.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Chance to get broken. He’s here cause to them you’re a sure thing, sure victory.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Not true.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Course it is.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Okay let’s be up front. This could be his last gig. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta make it count. (beat) We're talking about something the whole boxing world would want to see., we got the undisputed champion of today, we got the Icon in you (motions to Rocky) and we got the name of the best fighter ever all in one event? It'll be bloody historic.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Sure, Champ. Take some time to think on it. (to Adonis) In the mean time, if this thing’s gonna go, I’m gonna need you to do something on your end. We need you to take on the “Creed” name, formally.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I can’t do that. Not my name.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Then that’s a non- starter for us. Without the name, there’s no fight. Take a day to toss it around. Holiday stands up as Rocky and Adonis exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Can I get the day off?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I was gonna suggest the same thing. INT. BIANCA’S APARTMENT 88 Adonis and Bianca post- coital on Bianca’s air mattress. Bianca takes pulls off a roach, while Adonis looks up at ceiling.  71.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Patriarchy drives me insane. We carry the baby for nine months, wreck our bodies, almost die squeezing it out, only for society to slap the baby on the ass and name it after the man? (beat) The kid should at least get both names.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Which one goes first? Bianca cuts him a look that says 1,000 words. Adonis laug about this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I'd be Creed- Johnson. And you'd be...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Franklin- Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: But if you got pregnant...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: We

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: If we got pregnant, our kid’s last name would be... Franklin- Taylor- Creed- Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I didn’t think that far ahead... but you need to get over this name thing?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Can’t do it. Gotta make my own way.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: You've got a funny way of showing it. Weren’t Rocky and Apollo, like best friends? Seems like you're trying to tap into whatever it is he left behind. (beat) That’s nothing to be ashamed of, right? Adonis thinks about this for a beat. Then shakes his head  72.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of? (beat) I‘ll start it off for you, “I’m afraid of blank” Say it with me, I’m afraid of.... Adonis looks at her, almost as if to see if he can trust She looks back, waiting for his answer.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that... (beat) If I take the name on, and I loose. They’1l say I’m a let down. And not worthy of the name.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Who cares what people say.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You don’t know what it’s like.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I know what it’s like to be called a fraud. An embarrassment. Adonis looks over at her. She does understand.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you think it’s weird, that I do all these shows, and not once have you seen my family there? My parents aint 3,000 mi away. They’re down the street. Adonis thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What’s they deal.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: We Sunni, like everybody else out here. But my parents is just mad conservative. Once I started performing, and doing the music about life, they disowned me. Told me I was destined to fail. My own parents want to see me fail at what I love to do. Adonis thinks on this.  89 73.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never knew what it was like to have somebody in the crowd that I knew truly cared about me. Until you started coming to my shows. It changed everything for me.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: It’s crazy that they wouldn’t support you... I’ve seen you sing...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: And I've seen you fight. So what if people don’t think you're as great as Apollo. Who was? Think about what’s true. You love to box. It makes you happy, right? Adonis nods.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you are Apollo Creed’s grandson right? He nods again.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Use the name. It’s yours. Fuck what they say about you. I’1l be there for you, win or loose. Rocky’1l be there for you, win or loose. To hell with everybody else. INT. ADRIAN’S RESTAURANT-— DAY 89 Rocky stands in the stock room looking over merchandise, back door is open to the parking lot. Through the door, w see Adonis approach. He walks up to Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Ya really care?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, what are your thoughts on this.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Fighter’s only got ten good years, tops. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every battle takes something outta ya, and trust me, this one could take more than you’re willing to give. Adonis nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I can’t help but to think how jumpin into the deep end of the pool is how I got the best oppertunities in my life. Chances like this are one in a lifetime...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: So what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Let’s do it. Adonis nods.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One call and we're in.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Make the call. Rocky shrugs. Adonis looks at Rocky blankly for a beat, t is overwhelmed with emotion and takes off running out the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: PORRRTERRRR
dialogues.text: He jumps up and down and pumps his fist into the air. Roc looks on at this, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOUSEKEEPER brings the Wall St. Journal to Mary Anne, w eats breakfast at the kitchen island. She opens it up and flips to the front page. We see they have a photo of Adon smiling in an interview, right next to a photo of a young Apollo in an article about the bizarre nature of the upco title fight. Their resemblance is breathtaking.  91 92 93 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne wears a smock, and works on something. She take sip from a cup, but her eyes remain on the unseen project

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne mounts her project to the wall, revealed to be Adonis’ article in a custom frame. She steps back and adm it. Her eyes scan the wall and fall on something else. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- KITCHEN 93 Adonis is in the corner making a salad, while Bianca and Rocky meal around in the Kitchen cooking. Bianca checks on a pot bubbling on the stove, while Rocky stirs a pot of tomato sauce.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I’ve had sweet potatoes before.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Not like this, you haven't. Rocky smiles. Bianca opens the stove and pulls out a large baking sheet foil covering it. She sits it down on the counter and pee the foil back, revealing the orange dish.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Smells good. Bianca dips a small spoon into it, blows on it, hands it Rocky, who eats it. His face says it all.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tastes better. Bianca smiles, as her cell phone rings. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: (brightly) Hey... uh, yeah, give me a second. She heads towards the front door, past Adonis who notices something off in her voice. Adonis heads out after her. Rocky looks on, then takes another bit of sweet potatoes.  94 95 96 76. EXT. ROCKY’S HOUSE 94 Adonis looks at Bianca, who paces on the porch, wrapping what looks to be a very serious phone call.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I just talked to one of the top tour managers in the country.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: And...

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: He’s gonna be at the show tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (beat) That's amazing, right?

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: It’s just... It just feels like even more pressure.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Pressure’s good, it’s what you work so hard for. Bianca looks at Adonis for a beat, and smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come’‘on. I’m smelling that food you guys have been cooking up. They head inside. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE KITCHEN 95 The four of them eat dinner, and talk. It’s unconventiona but a family nonetheless. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- KITCHEN- LATER 96 Adonis washes the dishes, while Rocky dries them and puts them away. Bianca walks over to Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna take off, babe. Got the tech rehearsal early.  97 98 77.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I'll drive you.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Cab is already outside. (beat) Come early tomorrow, it’s gonna be crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I‘1l come straight from workouts. I won’t even shower.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Gross. I'll disown you... She gives him a hug, and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Knock em dead sweetheart. She playfully shadow boxes the air, then heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers drink coffee and bring equipment inside for the concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel sits at the counter watching Rocky work out Adonis the distance and the phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCEL
dialogues.text: Hello... yeah... who is this? Okay hold on. Marcel heads over to the ring where Rocky watches Adonis out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rock... its the hospital on the phone. This catches Adonis’ ear. Rocky looks around and sees everyone’s concern. He heads over to the phone and picks up.  99 78.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa, this is Dr. Shahani- would you be able to stop by today?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: It would actually be better if you came in to talk with us in person. Rocky looks over at his camp for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, wearing street clothes, sits in the consultation r Dr. Shahani sits across from him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Well, we went through your test results. And the neurological tests came back as I had expected. But your MRI and blood tests came back showing signs of Hodgekins lymphoma.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What’s that do?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Well Hodgekins is a very rare form of cancer.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Cancer?

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: The good news is, we caught while there is still a chance... We’ll have to remove the tumor in your lymph nodes, and start chemotherapy immediately. Rocky takes all of this in for a beat, while Dr. Shahani continues the prognosis. He stands up, grabs his coat.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Chemo- my wife tried that stuff. Didn't work out so good for her.  100 79.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa... I’d like to go over our options for treatment. Come up with a plan of action.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Gotta go. I’m very busy, Dr.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa, we caught this early enough that with treatment, you still have a very good chance of recovery. Without it, you have less than a 5% chance.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Got commitments. Can’t do it now. Rocky puts his coat on, and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Wait, at least take these. It has information on your diagnosis, and options for treatment... Rocky turns and looks at her for a beat, while holding th door open. He takes the pamphlets and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Joe Hand work drills. Rocky reenters the ring they finish up the round. Adonis walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What they say? You good to go?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Low iron. Gave me some pills- no problem. Adonis punches his gloves together, excited. Joe hands Ro the focus mitts, as the buzzer starts for a new round. He Adonis go at it with the drill.  101 102 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky gets ready to head into the showers, towel around h waist. He sits his clothes down on the bench and goes int the shower area. Adonis and Amir come into the locker room, laughing, but exhausted. They go over to their perspective lockers. Ado looks down at Rocky’s coat, hanging on the hook- notices pamphlets sticking out. He picks them up and starts to read them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky enters the room to get his jacket, and notices Adon waiting on him, staring him down.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: This shit foreal? He pulls out the pamphlets. Rocky snatches them from him throws them in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Don’t worry?! I thought you said the tests came back good.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What does it matter how the tests came back. You got Porter coming up, and can’t afford to get distracted.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: To hell with Porter. When do you start treatment?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m not doing no treatment.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You wanted me with ya trainin ya, and I appreciate that. But you gotta live ya own life. Don’t worry about mine, not at all.  103 81.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You don’t do the treatment, this will kill you. You fine with that?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s alright!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What? How is it alright? Why would anybody say that?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Cause dying is easy; Cause living the way I do, is very hard.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What do you mean, living the way you do?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Look around. Anybody who every loved me, anybody who ever knew me, is gone. Mickey, Apollo, Adrian, Paulie, I got my son, who I haven't seen in years. It’s like I was listening to some good song and it ended before it was suppose to. And I’m still dancin. I got nothing to hang around for.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m still here...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So what? You just showed up! You don’t know me! You’re just some fighter, you’re not family to me. This cuts Adonis deep. He takes off brushing past Rocky, watches him leave, then puts his face in his hands for a beat. He then pushes the locker, open handed- HARD. Again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis walks out of the gym, distraught. He puts his hand his head not knowing what to do, so he takes off jogging of frame. We hold for a few beats, and Rocky comes out looking for him. He’s nowhere to be found.  104 105 106 107 108 109 82. EXT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- NIGHT 104 Rocky walks out of the front door looking for Adonis. He opens the door and sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Kid? A UPS LADY walks up behind Rocky, with a package for him. turns and takes it, looking at it with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Series of shots Adonis jogs the familiar route. Several miles through the city of Philadelphia. Tears in his eyes. He arrives at the museum steps and sprints up them withou hesitation. He gets to the top, lays down on his back, an passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca, wearing leggins and a beautiful top, paces behind stage, getting ready to perform. She peeks out at the cro looking to see everyone getting seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Bianca- having a panic attack. She pukes into the toil wipes her mouth, takes some deep breaths, and pulls out h cellphone and calls a number. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- ADONIS’ BEDROOM- NIGHT 108 Adonis’ cellphone buzzes on his bed. “BIANCA CALLING” fla on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca talks into the phone, leaving a message.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Hey, you here yet? I’m freaking out over here... I gotta see you before I go on. I guess I'll keep trying you.  112 113 83. Bianca hangs up. She starts dialing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, still asleep on his back. A SECURITY GUARD wakes up. Adonis takes a deep breath in, and looks around. Slow realizing where he is. He looks down at his phone and fea flashes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! He takes off running down the steps and hails a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open close on Bianca’s face. She’s looking off into th crowd, where Adonis is nowhere to be found. The music sta and she starts singing, and she struggles... She looks in the crowd for a beat, then starts again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up on the street corner of the club, and Adon hops out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rihanna plays on stage as Adonis cuts through the sizeabl crowd towards the VIP section where we see Bianca and a f other musicians standing by the large metal fold up chair behind metal fencing.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (screaming over the music) Bianca! Bianca! Bianca sees him, and looks at him for a beat, before turn her back and disappearing deeper into the crowd. Two Secu Guards head over to the Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say bro, my girl is back there.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: No standing over here bro... The Security Guard firmly pushes Adonis against his chest Adonis knocks his hand away. And looks towards where Bian disappeared to.  114 84. He rushes the gate, in an attempt to get past the guards, one of them bear hugs Adonis across the neck. Adonis slip out, and punches him in the nose, dropping him. The Security Guard, his nose bleeding, picks up a folding chair. More guards run over to Adonis, grabbing him and punching him SMASH! One brings the folding chair right to side of Adonis’ face. Adonis falls as a guard pulls out handcuffs. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- ROCKY’S BEDROOM- NIGHT 114 Moonlight streams into the bedroom, where Rocky lies atop bed, half awake, half sleep. The house phone RINGS on his night stand, and he rolls over to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Rocky listens to the other end of the phone. He sighs dee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis sits in a solitary holding cell looking through pa bars. His face shows the signs of picking a fight with 2, lbs of security and a metal folding chair.

dialogues.speaker: COP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Right over here... He looks up towards the door as we hear the door buzz. We cut to the reverse to see Rocky standing outside the b with a COP (40’s, Italian American) who keys open the hol cell. Rocky walks in and closes the door behind him. Rocky walks over and sits down next to Adonis on the benc The two are silent for a beat. Rocky looks around at the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: They fixed this place up; use to be just one big cell. Very crappy. Maybe twenty upset guys in there at the same time. It got tense ina sense.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  85.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I know a few people, they say your friend’s downtown.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m not your friend. You're just a trainer to me, remember? This stings Rocky a bit.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to stay away from me man.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Something about me. I fuck everything up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Kid, that’s crazy talk.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: It’s true. My mom don’t talk to my grandma because of me. My dad got locked up soon as I was born... anybody who I ever get involved with, I fucked their lives up. Thought it'd be different out here. Thought it'd be me you, and Bianca, for years. Make our own family. (beat) It was never about one fight for me. It was about 20 fights, 20 years, day in day out. Us living, making memories. I never had that. Rocky reaches out to pat Adonis on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me. He knocks Rocky’s hand away.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just leave, man.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Kid...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Get outta here! (standing up) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get your old cripple ass outta here. We aint family. You let my real family die. This cuts Rocky to the core. Rocky stands up and stares Adonis down for a beat. Then heads towards the bars.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You got so much anger inside, kid. It makes you train hard. It makes you fight hard in the ring. But anger is poison. You can only run on it for so long, before it destroys you. But love... If you fill your heart up with love, you can fight forever. You're too hard on yourself. You got so much good inside. Rocky turns and walks out of the cell, while Adonis sits alone, with only the sound of the bars slamming to comfor him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the city. INT. MICKEY’S GYM- MORNING 117 Fighters preparing to work out look at the television, wh SPORTSCENTER is on the screen. The ANCHOR runs down the morning’s news.

dialogues.speaker: ESPN ANCHOR 2
dialogues.text: In boxing news light heavyweight contender Adonis “Creed” Johnson, was arrested late last night after his involvement in a brawl at the Union Transfer Music Club. Reportedly no charges are being filed against Johnson, who was not intoxicated at the time. Neither Johnson nor hit trainer Rocky Balboa could be reached for comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis stands up by the door, and a different COP (30s Hispanic, Female) unlocks the bars.  87.

dialogues.speaker: LADY COP
dialogues.text: Let’s go, Johnson. You’ve been bailed out.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Balboa?

dialogues.speaker: LADY COP
dialogues.text: No. Some lady. Adonis quickly pops up out of his seat at this news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, excited, walks outside of the doors and sees Lisa the sidewalk, arms crossed, staring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Lisa walk and talk.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: A part of me always knew this day was coming. (beat) You got it honest. Adonis looks at Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to be a fighter too. I think if daddy hadn’t had died, I would definitely have gotten into it.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Really? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: But I haven’t been able to watch a match since. Adonis takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you ever tell me that.  121 88.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Why do you think? (beat) So how bad is it, with Balboa?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: If he gets chemo, he has a chace...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: But he doesn’t want to... Adonis nods. Lisa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course not... That old macho shit is what got Daddy killed. You gotta talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I did. It was hard enough getting him to go to the hospital and get checked up.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You have to put it in terms that he understands... They stop.

dialogues.speaker: LISA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You talk to mom? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Have you? She shakes hers.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Something we can agree on now, I guess. Adonis smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Adonis embrace. And Adonis watches as Lisa goes through the glass sliding doors. He jumps back into the c and it pulls off.  122 123 124 89. EXT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- NIGHT 122 Adonis walks up the steps and keys into the front door. INT. ROCKY’S HOUSE- KITCHEN 123 Rocky sits at the dinner table, eating pasta and salad. H looks up as Adonis enters the door and walks in. There is beat of silence between Rocky and Adonis. Rocky gets up, and walks over to the cabinet and grabs a bowl. He puts some salad into it, some pasta, and then si it down on the table. Adonis sits down and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I’m not training if you don’t get treatment.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Eat. You look like you lost five pounds.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Can’t be taking orders from a quitter. You can’t throw the towel in to this cancer shit. Rocky thinks on this.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What makes this different than any of your other fights? (beat) If I fight, you fight. Rocky takes a long beat. And nods. Adonis extends his closed fist towards Rocky. Rocky punch it, and they eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky and Adonis sit across from Dr. Shahani

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Dr. Warren is going to walk you through the procedure. Rocky nods.  125 90.

dialogues.speaker: DR. WARREN
dialogues.text: So we'll be putting you under general anaesthesia, and removing the tumor from right here. Now once we're in there, if we see any other questionable tissue, we will remove that too.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: DR. WARREN
dialogues.text: As soon as possible. Rocky looks on at the CT Scan. Adonis standing beside him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky wakes up, hooked up to IVs in the dim room. He look over, and sees Adonis sitting in the corner looking back him. Rocky stiffly sits up, and starts pulling at his IVs, as he’s trying to leave. Adonis springs up.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Chill, chill, chill. It’s all good.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Did you get your workout in? Adonis shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I stayed. Rocky feels at his neck. There is a large bandage on the of it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: They get it all?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. They said they’11l come and talk to us about it when you wake up. Rocky starts feeling around his bed again.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chill out man, what you looking for.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Jacket... my jacket. Adonis reaches over to the chairs and grabs Rocky’s coat. hands it to him. Rocky digs in it and pulls out his stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go, pushups, burpies, sit- ups, shadow box super-sets. (beat) Let's go! Adonis looks at him like he’s fucking crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Right here?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You think Porter aint working out right now? You think he doesn’t want to dismember you in front of his people? (beat) Go! BEEP. Rocky hits the stopwatch. Adonis obliges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis works out at Joe Hand’s with Amir. Rocky sits ina chair, ringside still bandaged on his neck. Rocky gets hooked up to the chemotherapy machine. Two lar IV's hooked up to his arm. On the other side of the room, Adonis sets up a standing speed bag, and a standing body dummy. He installs a pullup bar in the door jam. Adonis works out, while Rocky receives treatment Adonis helps Rocky, weakened from the chemo session to th van. Adonis lifts weights in the gym. Adonis hauls massive bags of fertilizer in Rocky’s backya Rocky, bed ridden from the treatment, sits in bed, Adonis sits in the chair next to him. They watch tape on Porter.  126 92. Adonis holds Rocky as he vomits into the toilet. Adonis collapses while lifting bags of fertilizer. He sta down on all fours for a beat, then gets back up, and lift it. Rocky, having lost a bit of weight, wearing his hat, body bag, and gloves stands in the ring with Adonis, working h through blinding fast drills. Amir and Joe Hand, stand on either side of Adonis, throwing punches that Adonis parry Adonis jogs through North Philly. Several young black kid come out, and follow him. A group of Dirt bike riders fol suit, popping wheelies as a salute to Adonis. A young kid drives up next to Adonis on a mini- bike. Adonis, nearing the end of his route, takes off at full speed. The kid smashes on the gas. And all of the dirt bikes and ATV’s c up and slow down to keep right along Adonis, who is sprin now. They arrive at the gym and the bikers circle around Adonis, some even shadow box with him, others with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Rocky sit, Rocky in a hospital gown. They watc tape of Porter on Adonis’ iPad.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: His defense is so tough, you gotta stay patient kid, get him to come to you. On screen, Porter is picking his opponent apart. The door opens, and Dr. Shahani enters.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Worse body shots I ever tool. Don’t recommend it, but thanks Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: Well you should be feeling better now, and just in time. A bunch of us here at the hospital are getting the fight next weekend. We feel apart of the team! When do you guys take off?  93.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DR. SHAHANI
dialogues.text: So exciting... Well let’s get you going for this catscan. Adonis looks down at video, just in time to see Porter kn his opponent out, cold. Dr. Shahani walks Rocky out.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Hey Unc. Rocky turns around.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think I can do this? Rocky takes a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo you ever heard that story about the guy who said, “I Can” and the guy who said, “I Can't"?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Naw, how’s it go.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: They were both right. Adonis smiles at this. Rocky heads out of the door. 127 INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT HALLWAY 127 Adonis knocks on the door to Bianca’s apartment.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna need you to not come over here unannounced.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I just wanted to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean to let you down.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: What you meant to do don’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Look, Uncle Rock’s got cancer.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I found out right before your show, and I freaked out. It’s why I didn’t make it in time.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Jesus. How bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: It’s bad. Putting him through a whole round of chemo, and radiation. (beat) Tough son of a bitch is fighting, still has every hair left on his head. Bianca shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear that. (beat) Make sure you send him my love. She starts to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: B.
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do I gotta do? To get you to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: It’s my fault for letting you in. For putting so much in whether or not you show up. I can’t forgive myself for that. You’ve got alot going on. And I’m gonna focus on mine. Adonis takes this in, as Bianca closes the door.  128 129 130 131 95. INT. BIANCA’S APARTMENT 128 Bianca leans up against the other side of the door, holdi back tears. INT. ADONIS’ APARTMENT HALLWAY- CONTINUOUS 129 Adonis knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Bianca... open the door... He sighs, and leans on it with his palms placed high. He steps back and pulls an envelope out of his pocket. Then slides it under the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's everything you need to get out to Liverpool in there. It would mean a lot to me and Unc if you could make it. But if not, promise me you’ll at least watch. He waits for an answer from the other side of the door, a receives none. He heads off. INT. BIANCA’S APARTMENT 130 Bianca leans up against the other side of the door and listens to Adonis leave, holding back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, Rocky and their team stand in the boarding gate o the airport. Adonis holds his cellphone to the side of hi face, looking towards the escalator. Joe Hand, Marcel and Amir are preparing to board, looking back at Adonis. Adonis, frustrated, hangs up the phone. He starts to dial again when Rocky touches him on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: We gotta roll, kid. Plane aint gonna wait for us. Adonis looks back to his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She needs time, that’s all.  132 133 96. Adonis puts his phone back into his pocket and boards the plane with the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track a large international commercial airplane from underneath as it lands on the runway, we then boom up to reveal the London Skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter's camp sits at he press conference table on one si while Rocky, and Adonis sit on the other. Several reporters clamor for attention and have intense questions for Adonis and Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1
dialogues.text: Porter can we expect any more fireworks at the weigh in?

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: I’ve been doing a lot of anger management. And learning how to turn the other cheek, and whatnot.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: I just gotta make sure he unlearns all of this before Sunday morning. The crowd laughs.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2
dialogues.text: Balboa, there are rumors circulating back in the states about your health, some sources saying that you have been diagnosed with a serious health issue.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s called ageing. Very contagious, so watch out. The crowd guffaws.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 3
dialogues.text: I here has been questions raised about the odd nature of having a 5am start time, in order to maximize pay per view profits in the states. Could you both speak to how that might affect you.  97. Adonis looks at Porter, a bit unsure if he should go firs

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: If anything it’s an advantage for me, because it’1ll be normal fight time where I’m from.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: It’s simple for me. 5 in the morning is just as good a time for an ass whoopin as any other. Adonis leans over and mean mugs Porter, who isn’t even looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 4
dialogues.text: What about the contrast between you two, you the experience, the rags to riches background, vs. Johnson's overnight success.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Well I wouldn’t-

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Everybody's path is different. Some people have it better than others. My grandfather was a fisherman. His grandpa was the heavyweight champion of the world. Some people get things handed to them, while others have to earn it... Next question. The two fighters stare daggers at each other.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: There’s a lot of talk about legacy in this fight. Can you guys speak to that.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Well-

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Legacy is an interesting term. I feel that most great boxers have a common one. We all come from the struggle. Creed, Balboa, Porter. I’m carrying that tradition better than anybody. I’m the Rocky of this generation. I’m the Creed. It’s right here. Look no further. And you won’t have to come fight night.  134 98. Porter gets up, stares daggers at Adonis, and leaves. INT. LIVERPOOL HOTEL- ADONIS’ ROOM 134 Adonis closed off, wearing headphones, shadow boxes into hotel mirror. A KNOCK! at the door. Adonis opens it, to f Rocky outside holding a large white box. He passes it to Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t got X-Ray vision. Open it up. Adonis sits the box down atop the hotel bed. He quickly t it open. Adonis pulls out a pair of AMERICAN FLAG BOXING SHORTS with an insignia that reads CREED..

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Are these...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Your grandmother sent them to me, before we left Philly. You’1ll want to try ‘em on. I had to get them taken in quite a bit. Adonis tosses them up and down in his hands. He notices a white card inside the box, he pulls it out and we see tha reads WIN in Mary Anne’s regal handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Also, win or loose, I need you to do me a favor when we get back to Philly.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You promise?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: For sure. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. Just wanted to make sure we were locked in before the fight. You might be mad at me tomorrow, I don’t know.  135 136 137 138 99. Adonis laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (motions to the restroom) I’m gonna go in there and try these on... INT. LIVERPOOL HOTEL- ADONIS’ BATHROOM 135 Adonis slips the trunks on. They fit perfectly. He admire them in the mirror for a bit the size of the moment, the figurative weight of the shorts he now wears, hits him an he’s overwhelmed. The hotel phone ring from inside the bathroom. INT. LIVERPOOL HOTEL- ADONIS’ ROOM 136 Rocky walks over to the hotel phone and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hello... this is Rocky... Oh hey... you call to wish us luck? Rocky's face changes, and he sits down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... Okay... Thanks. Rocky hangs up the phone and thinks for a long beat. INT. BIANCA’S APARTMENT 137 Bianca, her cellphone pinched between her shoulder and he ear, talks into it while frantically packing a small bag.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’1l be out of my concert at about midnight. There is a flight at 12:45? Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a modest club, but the crowd is at capacity. Bianca finishes up a solo ballad, killing it. Her eyes open and scans the crowd, as she finishes, watching them clap. Her the band, head off stage.  139 140 141 142 143 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca and the band get backstage, The crowd can be heard chanting, “ENCORE, ENCORE, ENCORE”

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: You guys have to go back out. A couple more songs. Bianca looks down at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca frantically jumps into a taxi cab, with her carry luggage. It looks as if she ran straight from the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca runs through the airport as fast as she can move w her rolling luggage. She comes up to the gate just as the flight attendant closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Wait! The attendant ignores her. Bianca looks around, in panic mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca talks to a flight attendant behind a desk.

dialogues.speaker: AIRLINE AGENT
dialogues.text: Our best bet would be to put you standby on a flight to manchester.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: That's fine, I just have to get there, you don’t understand. The agent, continues to search through options for Bianca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, Rocky and camp arrive at the stadium. Security is getting in place for the match and Adonis and Rocky get o of the car and look at massive entrance of the iron gates  144 145 146 147 148 149 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot is full, and the exterior of the stadium alive with the electricity of a soccer match. Rowdy fans swarm the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, Apollo shorts and a modest robe rolls his neck, warming up. Rocky, Joe, and Amir sit in chairs behind him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter shadow boxes into the mirror, Holiday watches thro the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky laces his gloves his hands moving slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holiday wraps the tape around Porter’s glove, with expert precision. When done, Porter stands, Holiday sticks out h hand, and Porter punches it, hard. He turns to Junior, an close by.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Let’s give em a little action, for good luck now. Junior smiles and pounds his father’s gloves with all his might, top then bottom. Next, G, who does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky finishes the tape on Adonis’ glove. He struggles to tear the roll off... Amir sees this, and jumps in and qui tears it off. Rocky and Adonis lock hands Adonis matches him, and they back and forth like cobras.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: One step... one punch... one round... one fight.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: One step... one punch... one round... one fight... Rocky throws soft jabs at Adonis. They come slow but rhythmic. Adonis ducks each one with the same rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be more people than you've ever seen before in your life...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: One step... one punch... one round... one fight...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: But they don’t matter... Adonis continues saying the mantra.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're a long ways from home... but that don’t matter... all that matters is how much you want it... And you want it more than him, kid. I can see it in your eyes. INT. CALIFORNIA MEN’S COLONY- SAN LOUIS OBISPO 150 Terrel, in his cell, eats dinner off a tray, across from CELLY (Black, 50s). A Corrections Officer walks up to him and motions for him to come out. INT. CALIFORNIA MEN’S COLONY- SAN LOUIS OBISPO- HALLWAY 1 The CO leads Terrel down a hallway and opens a small room him. INT. CALIFORNIA MEN’S COLONY- SAN LOUIS OBISPO 152 Terrel walks inside the rec room, to find a chair sitting across from a small TV, with the fight on. He nods at the who nods back, and closes the door. He walks over and sit down.  153 154 155 156 157 158 159 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daryl and the kids sit on the couch watching cartoons. He sneaks off to Adonis’ room, where the fight is already cu up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary-Anne her tumbler next to her on the side table looks at the pay per view broadcast of the match. The Door Bell rings. She opens the door to find Lisa. Who walks straight to the couch and sits down in front of the television. Mary Anne thinks for a beat, then goes and si down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis continues to run drills with Rocky. The door opens the locker room, and a STADIUM STAFF MEMBER waves at them

dialogues.speaker: JOE HAND
dialogues.text: It’s time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis walks into view slowly, Rocky behind him, slower t we've seen him. His hand rests on Adonis’ shoulder for balance. Joe Hand, Amir, and Marcel walk out as well. The entire c a ball of nerves but they hide it well. Adonis’ INTRO MUS plays. It is the song Bianca made for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca is going through customs. The lines are massive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca looks at the time on her phone, then stares out of window of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis, Rocky and camp are walking through the entrance tunnel, and now approaching the stadium ramp. Stone faced walking in unison at a slow pace.  160 161 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a sea of Red Liverpool FC jerseys and some of the fa are wearing face paint. They boo, but the sound system dr most of it out.

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: It’s your night kid. This is what it’s all about. They arrive at the ring. Adonis bounces. He looks out and reality of the size of the stadium sets in. ADONIS’ POV FROM THE RING 40,000 screaming fans. The stadium is open up top, over t ring. Clouds circle overhead- a modern day Roman Coliseum fit to feed gladiators to lions.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rocky limps over to Adonis, places his hand on his should

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You freaking out?

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Very normal. First title fight, I almost passed out.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: What’d you do to stay cool?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Faked it. Like everybody does. Adonis nods. He throws some punches. Stay loose. Music starts, and the ENTIRE STADIUM SINGS “YOU'LL NEVER ALONE”- the Liverpool F.C. Anthem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter enters the stadium, with G sitting on his shoulder wearing a title belt, Holiday to his left, and Junior to right holding a belt in the air. Around him seems to be a least 40 of his friends and at least 10 championship belt The crowd is deafening.  162 105. Porter springs into the ring. His entourage floods into t ring and all of them stare down Adonis. Porter immediately comes out of his robe and we see his trunks, Red and Gold, a skirt with an English flag over i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adonis and Porter in the middle of the ring, alone, the REFEREE pulls them in. He talks in a thick Scouse accent.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Watch the hits below the belt, make sure you guys honor my commands, honor each other. We’ll make it a good fight, make it a hard fight, sound good? Both fighters nod.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go’on and touch em’ up.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Nice shorts. Too bad your grandpa ain't here to fight for ya. I’m gonna send you home, boy. Adonis’ eyes tighten in anger. Before he can respond Port sprints back to his corner. Adonis retreats to his.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Move your feet! Use the jab to keep him off of you! Adonis nods, the sound of the stadium fades out. DING DIN The fight begins. Porter closes the gap on Adonis at a near sprint, he’s fa and quickly sends two jabs at Adonis’ body, both connect. Adonis tries to counter, but Porter parries, and steps, pinning Adonis against the ropes. He goes to the body aga then swings a hook, that Adonis ducks and then grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Don’t hold on too tight ol’ boy. I’m just getting started. The Referee breaks up the hold.  163 164 106.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here mate. A little closer so you can learn a thing or two.. Adonis moves in slowly, when WHAM!, a lightning fast jab lands flush. Adonis stumbles, but before he can regain hi balance Porter sends a left hook, Adonis ducks just in ti He pops an uppercut to Porter’s body, but Porter blocks a slams Adonis with two more jabs before he knows what hit THE “10 SECOND CLAPS” SOUND as Adonis retreats, but Porte cuts him off, and sends a barrage of punches at Adonis’ h Adonis blocks most but when the round dings, but Porter s him across the face with a left hook.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: C'mon, that’s after the bell! The Ref signals that it was simultaneous. Adonis’ corner furious. INT. ADONIS’ CORNER 163 Adonis heads back to the corner, completely shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (to Joe) Give me the ice, give me the ice! Joe hands Rocky an ice pack, he slaps it over Adonis’ hea while the guys work on him.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (out of breath) He’s fucking fast!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: We knew that. We watched the tape but you’re still just watching. Okay? Don’t watch, take the fight to him! INT. PORTER’S CORNER 164 Holiday pours water into Porter’s mouth. The rest of the isn’t doing much, because “Pretty” Ricky is still just th Adonis hasn’t so much as touched him.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Don’t play around with this kid? I want you to put him away. Don’t care that it’s early. Put him down.  165 166 107. INT. ADONIS’ CORNER 165 Rocky gives Adonis water.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He really is that fast, he really is that good... but you know what? You belong in this ring with him, tonight. Go prove it. He puts his mouthpiece back in. The bell sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fighters approach each other quickly. Adonis dodges a couple punches then cages up, putting his hands over his and body to protect. Porter pounds Adonis’ body. A hard left connects with Ado ribs, causing Adonis’ mouthpiece to pop out. A thunderous right hook connects with Adonis’ jaw. Sending his mouthpi flying. He fakes the left hook, then hits Adonis with a r hook over the eye, opening his stitches.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Johnson is hurt. The ref slides in to save Adonis, and he stumbles over to grab his mouthpiece and replace it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: Johnson is saved by loosing his mouthpiece. He looks to be out on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: That gash above his left eye is leaking. Look for Porter to start attacking that side. Adonis smiles at Porter.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Let’s go! Is that all you’ve got? Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: (smiling back) I got plenty more. The ref gives them the clear sign.  108. Porter approaches, Adonis sways, like a cobra. He drops h hands, Ali style, baiting. Porter comes in, WHAM! Adonis sends a lightning fast jab that slips between Porter’s ha and catches him in the face. Porter stumbles back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Whoa. Johnson lands his first punch of the night on Porter.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUCER 2
dialogues.text: Yeah but it’s gonna have to take a lot more than that. Adonis comes back in on Porter and goes on the attack- Adonis throws combos, every third punch seems to land rig on target. Hard. Adonis dodges Porter’s counter punches Adonis swings a left jab to the body. CRACK! A hard right the bridge of Porter’s nose, opens him up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Porter’s hit, he looks to be cut! Porter bobs back but stays on his feet, Adonis gets greed and swings wildly. Porter ducks and hits Adonis with a straight shot, that sends down to the mat. The crowd erupts.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Get up! The referee counts. Adonis bounces back to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: First knockdown of the night for Porter, but Johnson is back on his feet. We’re gonna see a little more of this dynamite round 2. ANNOUNCER (CONT’D) Thank God for that. This was just getting good. The ref stops and checks with Adonis. Adonis straightens “10 SECOND CLAPS” sound. Porter’s wound bleeds over his e The fighters go right back at each other. Adonis is nicke with an uppercut to the chin, but comes back with two har straights to Porter's face.  167 109. The Bell sounds but Porter punch catches Adonis, who thro another set. They continue to box until both camps clear corners and jump into the ring to break them up. During the commotion Rocky is pushed down to the mat. Ado sees Rocky fall and snaps.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Let’s go, I ain't worried about the bell. Let’s do this right now!

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'm right here, mate. Don’t let those chumps hold ya back!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Take the gloves off! Fuck the bell! You gonna catch my fade! The two groups successfully get the fighters back to thei respective corners, but Adonis fumes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: These two guys are trying to destroy each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: Something has flipped here. Not to sound cliche but this just became and all out war. It’s gonna come down to who wants it more. Replays are shown of the devastating hits the two fighter delivered to each other. INT. ADONIS’ CORNER 167 Rocky, hurting from the fall, keeps his composure and pul Adonis’ mouthpiece out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m good, but I’m gonna have a heart attack if you don’t keep your damn hands up, kid. Marcel, goes to work on his eye, trying to stop the bleed  110.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see, you made him bleed. None of that Pretty Boy stuff matters. You get him to move his hands, and you stick him. You do that enough times, and he goes down just like anybody else! 168 INT. PORTER’S CORNER 168 The Cut Man struggles to put petroleum jelly on the gash Porter’s nose.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: I told you not to play around with him? What did I say now?

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: I’m gonna bash his head in.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: You’re gonna go back to what got us here, is what you’re gonna do. I don’t want you going shot for shot with this kid, his right is too strong. Protect yourself, keep him at a distance and score face and body. When he looses his patience and comes at you, make him pay! 169 ADONIS’ CORNER 169 Joe and Amir jump out of the ring. Adonis’ wound still is all the way closed up.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s okay to get mad. Use it, but stay in control. Remember, one step at a time.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: One punch at a time... One round at a time. DING, DING. Adonis and Porter exchange blows, with Porter consistentl getting the best of Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Another solid combination landed by Porter... a surgeon in the ring. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s picking the novice fighter apart. BELL SOUNDS A RING girls holds up a card for round 5. ADONIS’ CORNER 170 Rocky places the ice pack on Adonis’ head.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Then put your hands up. You gotta protect yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ring Girl holds up ROUND 7. Adonis, against the ropes, dodges machine-gun like assaul from Porter, his hands drop, Porter connects flush with a uppercut, and a bodyshot. Another jab to Adonis’ face, causing blood to flow from his left eye.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: Johnson is in big trouble now. The bell rings. Adonis knocks his own gloves together in frustration. He face swelling.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: It’s like watching reruns of the same fight, over, and over, and over again. It’s Porter just dismantling Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: Early on, we thought we were in for something special, but Porter is settling into that rare form, and just like he has proven time and time again, no one still has found the answer to that defense. ADONIS’ CORNER 172 Adonis is swollen and bleeding badly. The cut man sticks large cotton ball up his nose, and Adonis winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Johnson’s corner is really in trouble over there. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If they can’t stop that bleeding, they’re gonna have to cancel this fight.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: What we’re seeing right now, is the difference between someone who's good, and someone who’s great. It’s that simple. The Ring Girl Holds up a sign for ROUND 11.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re doing kid. But you’re killing me.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: I can slip him. He’s slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You can’t let him get you up against the ropes again, every time you try to slip, he gets you up against them. He’s pounding you. You gotta take them to the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porter has Adonis against the ropes, Adonis ducks a hook Porter and delivers a nasty straight shot followed by a b crunching hook to the body. The hook doubles Porter over, ties up. While tied up, Adonis throws body shots to the s spot. He breaks loose, Porter ducks down, and their heads collide. The wound above Adonis’ left eye opens up even m Adonis stumbles back in pain. The ref runs up to Adonis.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: You okay? Adonis nods, grimacing, blood flowing into his left eye . Referee turns to Porter.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s a warning. The fight resumes. Porter’s in attack mode. Adonis, who c barely see dodges the first couple, but some connect. Por pounds away at his left glove, working the cut. DING DING Adonis is saved by the bell. Adonis’ corner is furious, shouting at the Ref.  174 175 176 177 178 179 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca, following a stadium escort, runs down to her ring seat. She sees Adonis’ condition and tries to run past th ring security, who stop her.

dialogues.speaker: BIANCA
dialogues.text: Rocky! Rocky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky snaps his head around and sees Bianca.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Let her through! She’s with us! Let her through!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security turns to Rocky, and obliges. Bianca runs up ringside gate, just out of reach. INT. ADONIS’ CORNER 177 Adonis’ cut is in bad shape. They work on it. Rocky bends down to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Look at me... look at me! (Adonis looks up at Rocky) Look who made it... Rocky turns Adonis’ head towards Bianca. Adonis looks at and his eyes grow wide with recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bianca is moved to tears by the condition of his face. Sh covers her mouth to try to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hey... Rocky turns his head back to the fight.  114.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s here because she loves you. I’m here because I love you. Your family back home loves you. You've got nothing else to prove. Nothing to prove to me, nothing to prove to yourself. I’m gonna stop this fight.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (quickly) Don’t. Let me finish-

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Just finishing ain’t worth it! (beat) I lied to you last night... It was the hospital that called. Adonis’ eyes grow wide.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say they found more... Adonis winces at this. It’s too much for him to take righ now.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never got to tell Apollo thank you, for what he did for me. He gave me a title shot, when I was a piece of shit leg breaker, he trained me after Mickey died. But those gifts were nothing compared to you, kid. You showed me how to fight again... Gave me something to look forward to. And I’m gonna go home and fight this thing. Just like I been doing. But if I fight, you fight! Now if you tell me all you want to do is finish, to prove something to yourself, goddamn it, I‘1l throw this towel in right now...

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So you're telling me you’re gonna go back in there and knock that son of a bitch out? Adonis nods.  180 115.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say it!

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I’m gonna knock that son of a bitch out.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It’s three minutes! One punch at a time. All your pain, all your love. Turn it loose kid, don’t hold anything back.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Times up. Let’s go. Adonis stands up, battered and bruised, left eye closed. ADONIS’ POV-Porter stands at his corner, barely in focus. Porter’s face wounded, but confident. He’s been here befo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two fighters approach each other slowly. Adonis drops gloves baiting Porter. He beckons Porter with his right h

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS
dialogues.text: Come on! Porter comes in swinging, quick left jabs, Adonis parries them all, and bounces back. He taunts Porter again.

dialogues.speaker: ADONIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You the champ, right? Come show me! Hands dropped, Porter leads with Jabs. Adonis dodges; counters with a straight right to Porter’s nose and a lef hook to Porter’s right temple, cutting him again. Adonis, smelling blood, attacks. Rapid fire head shots at Porter; it has digressed into a street fight. Porter regains his balance, then matches Adonis intensity The two men swing wildly at each other. Adonis lands another punch. Porter ties him up, blood spilling on Adonis’ shoulder. Adonis pushes him off hard, sending Porter back to the middle of the ring.  116.

dialogues.speaker: HOLIDAY
dialogues.text: Stay away from him! Stay away and win out the bloody round! Adonis bangs his gloves together, and Porter bangs his together in response. Both men ready to brawl to the fini Porter throws hard jab which lands, but Adonis un-phased, leans in and throws a left hook; Porter ducks, but it lan on the crown of his head; Adonis follows with a right cro right to Porter’s face. It connects flush, hard, sending Porter to the mat in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: LET'S GO
